title: PartialKey code
contents:
module Data.Set.PartialMatch where

import Data.Set (Set, size, union)
import System.IO.Unsafe

import qualified Data.Set as Set (filter, fromDistinctAscList)

partialMatch :: Ord a => Set [a] -> [Maybe a] -> Set [a]
partialMatch s k = Set.filter (elemMatch k) s
    where
    elemMatch keys elem =
        case length keys == length elem of
            False -> False;
            True  -> and $ zipWith (\jk e -> case jk of Nothing -> True; Just a -> a == e) keys elem

allWords :: IO (Set String)
allWords = do
           words' <- readFile "/usr/share/dict/words"
           return $ Set.fromDistinctAscList $ words words'

dictWords = unsafePerformIO allWords

sampleSearch = flip partialMatch [Nothing, Just 'a', Nothing,Just 'o',Nothing] dictWords

title: counting sort
contents:
countSort :: ByteString -> ByteString
countSort (PS input s l) = create l $ \p -> allocaArray 256 $ \arr -> do
    memset (castPtr arr) 0 (256 * fromIntegral (sizeOf (undefined :: CSize)))
    let doCount :: Ptr Word8 -> Int -> IO ()
        doCount ptr i =
            if i == l
                then return ()
                else do
                    k <- fmap fromIntegral $ peekElemOff ptr i
                    x <- peekElemOff arr k
                    pokeElemOff arr k (x + 1)
                    doCount ptr (i + 1)
    withForeignPtr input (flip doCount 0 . (`plusPtr` s))
    let go 256 _ = return ()
        go i ptr = do
            n <- peekElemOff arr i
            if n /= 0
                then memset ptr (fromIntegral i) n >> return ()
                else return ()
            go (i + 1) (ptr `plusPtr` (fromIntegral n))
    go 0 p

title: deftransform abuse?
contents:
;; I'm not sure if this is wise or not, but I think it sort of
;; does what I want:

(sb-c:defknown mref2 (matrix fixnum fixnum) number
  (sb-c:flushable sb-c:movable))

(sb-c:deftransform mref2 ((m row col))
  (print (sb-c::classoid-name (sb-c::lvar-type m)))
  (case (sb-c::classoid-name (sb-c::lvar-type m))
    (double-float-matrix
     `(let ((a (matrix-vals m)))
        (declare (type (simple-array double-float (* *)) a))
        (aref a row col)))
    (single-float-matrix
     `(let ((a (matrix-vals m)))
        (declare (type (simple-array single-float (* *)) a))
        (aref a row col)))
    (t
     `(aref (matrix-vals m) row col))))


;; and then, e.g.:

(defun matrix-bench-14 ()
  (let ((x (make-instance 'single-float-matrix :rows 1024 :cols 1024 :initial-element 1s0)))
    (declare (type single-float-matrix x))
    (let ((acc 0s0)
          (rows (rows x))
          (cols (cols x)))
      (declare (type single-float acc)
               (type fixnum rows cols))
      (dotimes (i rows)
        (declare (type fixnum i))
        (dotimes (j cols)
          (declare (type fixnum j))
          (setf acc (+ acc (the single-float (clem::mref2 x i j))))))
      (print acc))))

; map operations

(define (factorial x)
  (cond
    ((= x 1) 1)
    (else (* x (factorial (- x 1))))))

(define-external (factorial (int x)) int
                 (factorial x))

title: Schöner schreiben mit Scheme
contents:
[with (bound-id
       named-expr
       bound-body)
      (let ((tmp (hash-table-get-default sub-rep
                                         bound-id
                                         0)))
        (hash-table-put! sub-rep
                         bound-id
                         (interp named-expr
                                 fun-defs
                                 sub-rep))
        (let ((ret (interp bound-body
                           fun-defs
                           sub-rep)))
          (hash-table-put! sub-rep
                           bound-id
                           tmp)
          ret))]

title: Smugmug JS
lisp
contents:
(defun traverse (examples attribs default)


(print "start of attribs")
(print attribs)


(cond ((null examples) (print "there is no example") default)
      ((not (null(same examples))) (print "the examples are the same") (print (same examples)))
      ((null attribs)(print "attrib is empty!")(majority examples))

      (t (setq max 0)

        (print "yes i am in")
        ;choose best attribute
        (if (atom (first attribs))(setq best (first attribs))(progn 
        (dolist (choice attribs)
          (setq current (gain examples choice attribs))

          (when (> current max)(progn (setq max current)(setq best choice))))))
 

 
        (setq tree (list best))
    
        (setq m (majority examples))
  

      
        (setq values '())
        (dolist (choice examples)
          (push (nth (position best attribs) choice) values)
        )
        (setq realvalues(remove-duplicates values))
        (print realvalues)
  

      
        (dolist (v realvalues)
          (setq new_examples '())
          ;examples <- all examples wth best =v
          (dolist (choice examples)

            (when (equal (nth (position best attribs) choice) v)
                  (setf new_choice (remove-nth (position best attribs) choice))
                  (push new_choice new_examples)))
            
            (print best)
            (print v)
            (print new_examples)
            

    
         )
        )
    
  ))

title: formated
contents:
(define (ex list)
  (display "enter : ") (display list) (newline)
  (if (= 1 (car list))
      (begin  
        (set-car! list (- (car list) 1))
        (ex list))
      (set-car! list (+ (car list) 1)))
  (display "exit : ") (display list) (newline))

title: remove-nth in DrScheme

(require (lib "trace.ss"))
                           
(define (remove-nth n list)
  (if (= n 0)
      (rest list) 
      (cons (first list) (remove-nth (- n 1) (rest list)))))

title: prime numbers
contents:
(define (genlist x y)
  (if (< y 1)
      ()
  (cons x (genlist (+ x 1) (- y 1)))))

(define (primes x)
  (if (< x 1)
      ()
    (let ((numlist (genlist 1 x)))
      (primes-iter numlist x 2))))

(define (findprime x l)
  (if (equal? l ())
      ()
    (if (> (car l) x)
	(car l)
      (findprime x (cdr l)))))

(define (primes-iter plist x y)
  (if (or (equal? y ()) (> y x))
	     plist
    (primes-iter
     (map (lambda (c) (if (and (< y c) (equal? (modulo c y) 0)) 0 c))
	  plist)
     x (findprime y plist))))

(defun make-single-float (bits)
  (cond
    ;; IEEE float special cases
    ((zerop bits) 0.0)
    ((= bits #x-80000000) -0.0)
    (t (let* ((sign (ecase (ldb (byte 1 31) bits)
                      (0  1.0)
                      (1 -1.0)))
              (iexpt (ldb (byte 8 23) bits))
              (expt (if (zerop iexpt) ; denormalized
                        -126
                        (- iexpt 127)))
              (mant (* (logior (ldb (byte 23 0) bits)
                               (if (zerop iexpt)
                                   0
                                   (ash 1 23)))
                       (expt 0.5 23))))
	 (* sign (expt 2.0 expt) mant)))))

title: Polymorphic?
contents:
module ClientServer where

import System.IO

import UTrace

data CsOperationStatus = Successful | Unsuccessful
    deriving (Read, Show)

class HasStatus a where
    getStatus :: a -> CsOperationStatus

class (Show request, Read request, HasStatus request) => Request request where

    putRequest :: Handle -> request -> IO ()
    putRequest handle msg = hPrint handle msg >> hFlush handle

    getRequest :: (HasStatus request) => Handle -> IO request
    getRequest handle = do
        msg <- hGetLine handle >>= readIO
        case (getStatus msg) of
            Successful -> return msg
            _ -> ioError (userError "c/s communication error")

class (Show response, Read response) => Response response where

    putResponse :: Handle -> response -> IO ()
    putResponse handle msg = hPrint handle msg >> hFlush handle

    getResponse :: (HasStatus response) => Handle -> IO response
    getResponse handle = do
        msg <- hGetLine handle >>= readIO
        case (getStatus msg) of 
            Successful -> return msg
            _          -> ioError (userError "c/s communication error")

{-
    the request->response added here still left ambiguity, if you trust the
    message the ambiguity is related to the fact that something is both
    HasStatus and Response.  I can take HasStatus out if necessary, or perhaps
    that can be included somehow.  For the moment I'm commenting out
    putRequestDR here and uncommenting it in Controller.hs
-}
class (Request request, Response response) => Server request response | request -> response where
    handleRequest :: request -> IO response

    --  the Bool is to turn tracing on/off
    runServer :: Handle -> IO (S request response)
    runServer handle = do
        repeatM_ $ do
            (request  :: request) <- getRequest handle
            tsPrint Verbose $ (show request)
            (response :: response) <- handleRequest request
            tsPrint Verbose $ (show response)
            putResponse handle response
        return S

    -- runRequest

data S a b = S

-- main = runServer stdin (S :: S LoadtestRequest LoadtestResponse)

-- utilities
--
repeatM_ :: forall m a. Monad m => m a -> m ()
repeatM_ a = a >> repeatM_ a

-- put request get response
putRequestGR handle req = do
    tsPrint SeriouslyVerbose $ "putRequestGR, put for " ++ (show req)
    putRequest handle req
    tsPrint SeriouslyVerbose $ "putRequest complete, calling getResponse..."
    resp <- getResponse handle
    tsPrint SeriouslyVerbose $ "returned from getResponse, resp=" ++ (show resp)
    return resp

-- put request discard response

putRequestDR handle req = do
    tsPrint SeriouslyVerbose $ "putRequestDR, put for " ++ (show req)
    putRequest handle req
    tsPrint SeriouslyVerbose $ "putRequestDR, putRequest complete, calling getResponse..."
    _ <- getResponse handle
    tsPrint SeriouslyVerbose $ "putRequestDR, returned from getResponse"
    return ()

(defmacro make-db-class (name fields)
  `(progn (defclass ,name ()
            ,(loop for field in fields collect 
                   `(,field :initform ()
                            :initarg ,(intern (symbol-name field) "KEYWORD")
                            :accessor ,field)))
     (defmacro ,(intern (concatenate 'string
                                     "WITH-ALL-" (symbol-name name) "-SLOTS"))
               (object &body body)
       `(with-slots ,',fields ,object ,@body))))

(make-db-class contacts (first-name last-name))

(defun test ()
  (let ((foo (make-instance 'contacts)))
    (with-all-contacts-slots foo

      (format t "~a ~a" first-name last-name))))

title: What am I doing wrong here?
can I make this polymorphic?
contents:
All, I have two versions of essential the same function.  The only difference is that putRequestGR (put request get response) returns a value of a type that is an instance of Respone.  (The classes are below.)  putRequestDR (put request discard response is identical, except that instead of returning the value, it discards it.

The problem is that the compiler refuses to compile putRequestDR without the type annotaion on the getResponse call.  For putRequestGR the type of the response value can be inferred.  Since putRequestDR doesn't return it, the compiler doesn't have any way to infer the type.

So putRequestGR works fine for any instances of classes Resquest and Response.

Is there any way to annotate putRequestDR so that it can be polymorphic?  Or, is there any way to convince the compiler that, since we are discarding the value, it can really stop worrying about the type?

Thanks,
Seth

-- put request get response
putRequestGR handle req = do
    putRequest handle req
    resp <- getResponse handle
    return resp

-- put request discard response
putRequestDR handle req = do
    putRequest handle req
    (_ :: ControllerCommResponse) <- getResponse handle
    return ()


Here is a paste of the entire file containing the class definitions.  (Note that putRequestGR is repeated; I used the one above because I removed trace statements to get rid of their noise.)


module ClientServer where

import System.IO

import UTrace

data CsOperationStatus = Successful | Unsuccessful
    deriving (Read, Show)

class HasStatus a where
    getStatus :: a -> CsOperationStatus

class (Show request, Read request, HasStatus request) => Request request where

    putRequest :: Handle -> request -> IO ()
    putRequest handle msg = hPrint handle msg >> hFlush handle

    getRequest :: (HasStatus request) => Handle -> IO request
    getRequest handle = do
        msg <- hGetLine handle >>= readIO
        case (getStatus msg) of
            Successful -> return msg
            _ -> ioError (userError "c/s communication error")

class (Show response, Read response) => Response response where

    putResponse :: Handle -> response -> IO ()
    putResponse handle msg = hPrint handle msg >> hFlush handle

    getResponse :: (HasStatus response) => Handle -> IO response
    getResponse handle = do
        msg <- hGetLine handle >>= readIO
        case (getStatus msg) of 
            Successful -> return msg
            _          -> ioError (userError "c/s communication error")

class (Request request, Response response) => Server request response where
    handleRequest :: request -> IO response

    --  the Bool is to turn tracing on/off
    runServer :: Handle -> IO (S request response)
    runServer handle = do
        repeatM_ $ do
            (request  :: request) <- getRequest handle
            tsPrint Verbose $ (show request)
            (response :: response) <- handleRequest request
            tsPrint Verbose $ (show response)
            putResponse handle response
        return S

    -- runRequest

data S a b = S

-- main = runServer stdin (S :: S LoadtestRequest LoadtestResponse)

-- utilities
--
repeatM_ :: forall m a. Monad m => m a -> m ()
repeatM_ a = a >> repeatM_ a

-- put request get response
putRequestGR handle req = do
    tsPrint SeriouslyVerbose $ "putRequestGR, put for " ++ (show req)
    putRequest handle req
    tsPrint SeriouslyVerbose $ "putRequest complete, calling getResponse..."
    resp <- getResponse handle
    tsPrint SeriouslyVerbose $ "returned from getResponse, resp=" ++ (show resp)
    return resp

(else (cons (car lis) (guess s1 s2 (cdr lis))))))

What does the function guess do? Show the result applying guess to an example

Subject: CACert Assurances in Raleigh-Durham, North Carolina

At the monthly meeting in May of the Triangle Linux Users 
Group, one of the largest linux user groups on the east coast 
of the United States, Tanner Lovelace will present a 
presentation about CACert.  The meeting will be held on May 11th at 7pm at Red Hat World Headquarters (http://www.redhat.com/about/contact/ww/americas/raleigh.html) in Raleigh, NC.  In conjunction with the presentation, we 
will be coordinating a CACert Assurance.  CACert has 
graciously granted Super Assurer 
(http://wiki.cacert.org/wiki/SuperAssurers) status so that 
full assurance may be granted on the spot.  Make sure you

; I want to fetch the shortest string in a list of strings

; This gives the length of the desired string, not the string itself.
(reduce #'min stringlist :key #'length)

; Is there anything more elegant than this?
(reduce #'(lambda (a b)
            (if (< (length a) (length b))
              a
              b))
        stringlist)

title: dirty, dirty fmt
contents:
;;; fixme: this algo is real nasty
(define (fill-paragraph s)
  (in (string-drop s* 1)                ; remove the leading space
    (let ((s* (unlines 
               (reverse 
                (fold (lambda (w ls)
                        (if (< (+ (string-length w)
                                  (string-length (car ls)))
                               +page-width+)
                            (cons (string-append (car ls) " " w)
                                  (cdr ls))
                            (cons w ls)))
                      '("")
                      (words s)))))))))


;; deps
(define words   (cut string-tokenize <> (char-set-complement char-set:whitespace)))
(define lines   (cut string-tokenize <> (char-set-complement (char-set #\newline))))
(define unwords (cut string-join <> (string #\space)))
(define unlines (cut string-join <> (string #\newline)))

(define-syntax in
  (syntax-rules ()
    ((in x (let    bs))         (let    bs x))
    ((in x (let*   bs))         (let*   bs x))
    ((in x (letrec bs))         (letrec bs x))
    ((in x (define . b) ...)    (let () (define . b) ... x))))

    =<< P.getContents

title: Failing monte carlo
contents:
;open a door
(defun open-door (scenario n)
  (cond ((= n 0) (getf scenario :a))
        ((= n 1) (getf scenario :b))
        ((= n 2) (getf scenario :c))))

;generate single scenario
(defun gen-scenario (randn)
  (list :a (= randn 0) :b (= randn 1) :c (= randn 2)))

;host action
(defun host-look (scenario door)
    (list :first (open-door scenario door) :second (not (open-door scenario door))))

(defun sticky-pick (iters success)
  (let ((scenario (gen-scenario (random 3))) ; gen scenario
        (pick (random 3)))                   ; establish which door to pick
    (if (open-door (host-look scenario pick) 0) ; if the door is a winner
        (incf success)))                     ; increment success counter
  (if (equal iters 0)                        ; if the computation is done
      (format t "Sticky successes: ~d~%" (+ 0 success)) ; Return success number
      (sticky-pick (1- iters) success)))     ; otherwise, call self with decremented counter

;switch picker
(defun switch-pick (iters success)
  (let ((scenario (gen-scenario (random 3))) ; gen scenario
        (pick (random 3)))                   ; establish which door to pick
    (if (open-door (host-look scenario pick) 1) ;if the door is a winner
        (incf success)))                     ; increment success counter
  (if (equal iters 0)                        ; if the computation is done
      (format t "Switch successes: ~d~%" (+ 0 success))
      (switch-pick (1- iters) success)))       ; otherwise, call self with decremented counter

title: crashesOnExit
contents:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
{-| Module      : Main
    Copyright   : Graviton Studios 2006
    License     : All Rights Reserved

    Maintainer  : ryant5000@yahoo.com
    Stability   : alpha
    Portability : universal
-}
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

module Main where

import System.IO
import Foreign
import qualified Graphics.UI.SDL as SDL
import qualified Graphics.UI.SDL.TTF as TTF
import qualified Graphics.Rendering.OpenGL as OpenGL
import Data.Maybe
import Data.Array.IArray
import Data.Array.Storable
import Data.Array.MArray
import Data.Word
import Data.List
import Control.Concurrent
import System.Exit

screenWidth :: Num a => a
screenWidth = 800

screenHeight :: Num a => a
screenHeight = 600

screenAspect :: Floating a => a
screenAspect = screenWidth/screenHeight

bufferFlags = [SDL.OpenGL]

main :: IO ()
main = do
	SDL.withInit [SDL.InitVideo] $ do
		screen <- setupSdl
		setupOpengl
		SDL.enableKeyRepeat 500 30
		mainLoop screen 45 0 2
		--SDL.enableEvent (SDL.SDLUserEvent 1) True
		putStrLn "a"
		TTF.quit
		putStrLn "b"
	putStrLn "c"
	exitWith ExitSuccess

setupSdl :: IO SDL.Surface
setupSdl = do
	TTF.init
	SDL.glSetAttribute SDL.glRedSize 5
	SDL.glSetAttribute SDL.glGreenSize 5
	SDL.glSetAttribute SDL.glBlueSize 5
	SDL.glSetAttribute SDL.glDepthSize 16
	SDL.glSetAttribute SDL.glDoubleBuffer 1
	bpp <- SDL.videoModeOK screenWidth screenHeight 16 bufferFlags
	screen <- SDL.setVideoMode screenWidth screenHeight (fromJust bpp) bufferFlags
	SDL.setClipRect screen Nothing
	return screen

showPixels :: SDL.Surface -> IO String
showPixels surface = SDL.surfaceGetPixels surface >>= showRawArray (4*(SDL.surfaceGetWidth surface * SDL.surfaceGetHeight surface))

showRawArray :: Int -> Ptr a -> IO String
showRawArray bytes p = do
	vals::[Word8] <- mapM (peekByteOff p) [0..(bytes - 1)]
	return $ (show p) ++ (concatMap ((++ " ") . show) vals)

data AssocBitmap a = AssocBitmap (Int, Int) [((Int, Int), OpenGL.Color4 a)]

surfaceToAssocBitmap :: (Fractional a) => SDL.Surface -> IO (AssocBitmap a)
surfaceToAssocBitmap surface = do
	let { w = SDL.surfaceGetWidth surface ; h = SDL.surfaceGetHeight surface }
	pixels <- SDL.surfaceGetPixels surface
	print pixels
	vals::[Word8] <- mapM (peekByteOff pixels) [0..(w*h*4 - 1)]
	return $ AssocBitmap (w, h) $ zip [(x, y) | y <- [0..(h-1)], x <- [0..(w-1)]] $ colorify vals where
		colorify (r:g:b:a : tail) = OpenGL.Color4 ((fromIntegral r)/255) ((fromIntegral g)/255) ((fromIntegral b)/255) ((fromIntegral a)/255) : colorify tail
		colorify [] = []

flipAssocBitmap :: (Bool, Bool) -> AssocBitmap a -> AssocBitmap a
flipAssocBitmap (flipX, flipY) (AssocBitmap size@(w, h) assocs) = AssocBitmap size $ map (\((x, y), c) -> ((if flipX then (w-1)-x else x, if flipY then (h-1)-y else y), c)) assocs

nextPowerOf2 :: (Num a, Ord a) => a -> a
nextPowerOf2 n = fromJust $ find (\x -> x > n) $ iterate (*2) 1

resizeWithoutScale :: (Int, Int) -> OpenGL.Color4 a -> AssocBitmap a -> AssocBitmap a
resizeWithoutScale size@(w, h) bgFill (AssocBitmap (oldW, oldH) assocs) = AssocBitmap size $ [((x, y), bgFill) | x <- [oldW..(w-1)], y <- [0..(h-1)]] ++ [((x, y), bgFill) | x <- [0..(oldW-1)], y <- [oldH..(h-1)]] ++ filter (\((x, y), _) -> x < w && y < h) assocs

makeTexture :: (RealFrac a, Storable a, Fractional b) => OpenGL.DataType -> OpenGL.Color4 a -> AssocBitmap a -> IO (b, b)
makeTexture gltype bgFill orig@(AssocBitmap (origW, origH) origAssocs) = do
	let
		size@(w, h) = (nextPowerOf2 origW, nextPowerOf2 origH)
		(AssocBitmap _ assocs) = resizeWithoutScale size bgFill $ flipAssocBitmap (False, True) orig
		convert x = (round (x * 255)) :: Word8
	pixelArray <- newArray_ ((0, 0), (h-1, w-1))
	mapM_ ((uncurry $ uncurry $ flip $ curry $ writeArray pixelArray) . (\(i, OpenGL.Color4 r g b a) -> (i, OpenGL.Color4 (convert r) (convert g) (convert b) (convert a)))) assocs
	withStorableArray pixelArray $ OpenGL.texImage2D Nothing OpenGL.NoProxy 0 OpenGL.RGBA' (OpenGL.TextureSize2D (fromIntegral w) (fromIntegral h)) 0 . OpenGL.PixelData OpenGL.RGBA OpenGL.UnsignedByte
	return (fromIntegral origW / fromIntegral w, fromIntegral origH / fromIntegral h)

setupOpengl :: IO ()
setupOpengl = do
	let
		textureWidth = 32
		textureHeight = 32
		textureSize = OpenGL.TextureSize2D (fromIntegral textureWidth) (fromIntegral textureHeight)
	OpenGL.viewport OpenGL.$= (OpenGL.Position 0 0, OpenGL.Size screenWidth screenHeight)
	OpenGL.matrixMode OpenGL.$= OpenGL.Projection
	OpenGL.loadIdentity
	OpenGL.perspective 60 screenAspect 0.1 100
	OpenGL.matrixMode OpenGL.$= OpenGL.Projection
	OpenGL.clearColor OpenGL.$= (OpenGL.Color4 0 0 0 0)
	OpenGL.depthFunc OpenGL.$= Just OpenGL.Less
	OpenGL.blendFunc OpenGL.$= (OpenGL.SrcAlpha, OpenGL.OneMinusSrcAlpha)
	OpenGL.blend OpenGL.$= OpenGL.Enabled
	OpenGL.cullFace OpenGL.$= Nothing
	OpenGL.texture OpenGL.Texture2D OpenGL.$= OpenGL.Enabled
	OpenGL.textureFunction OpenGL.$= OpenGL.Decal
	[tex] <- OpenGL.genObjectNames 1
	OpenGL.textureBinding OpenGL.Texture2D OpenGL.$= Just tex
	OpenGL.textureWrapMode OpenGL.Texture2D OpenGL.S OpenGL.$= (OpenGL.Repeated, OpenGL.Repeat)
	OpenGL.textureWrapMode OpenGL.Texture2D OpenGL.T OpenGL.$= (OpenGL.Repeated, OpenGL.Repeat)
	OpenGL.textureFilter OpenGL.Texture2D OpenGL.$= ((OpenGL.Nearest, Nothing), OpenGL.Nearest)
	font <- TTF.openFont "c:\\windows\\fonts\\arial.ttf" 12
	textImage <- TTF.renderTextBlended font "Hello" (SDL.Color 255 255 255)
	print (SDL.surfaceGetWidth textImage, SDL.surfaceGetHeight textImage)
	SDL.lockSurface textImage
	pixels :: AssocBitmap Double <- surfaceToAssocBitmap textImage
	SDL.unlockSurface textImage
	makeTexture OpenGL.Double (OpenGL.Color4 1 1 1 1) pixels
	return ()

--mainLoop :: Num a => Surface -> a -> a -> a -> IO ()
mainLoop screen yaw pitch level = do
	event <- SDL.pollEvent
	let { continue = mainLoop screen yaw pitch level ; unrecognized = {-putStrLn (show event) >>-} continue } in case event of
		SDL.Quit -> return ()
		SDL.KeyDown (SDL.Keysym key _ _) -> case key of
			SDL.SDLK_a -> mainLoop screen (yaw + 1) pitch level
			SDL.SDLK_z -> mainLoop screen (yaw - 1) pitch level
			SDL.SDLK_s -> mainLoop screen yaw (pitch + 1) level
			SDL.SDLK_x -> mainLoop screen yaw (pitch - 1) level
			SDL.SDLK_d -> mainLoop screen yaw pitch (level + 1)
			SDL.SDLK_c -> mainLoop screen yaw pitch (level - 1)
			SDL.SDLK_q -> return ()
			_ -> unrecognized
		SDL.NoEvent -> do
			repaint screen yaw pitch level
			continue
		_ ->  unrecognized

repaint screen yaw pitch level = do
	OpenGL.clear [OpenGL.ColorBuffer, OpenGL.DepthBuffer]
	OpenGL.loadIdentity
	OpenGL.frustum (-1) 1 (-1) 1 1 3
	OpenGL.translate (OpenGL.Vector3 0 0 (-2::OpenGL.GLfloat))
	OpenGL.preservingMatrix $ do
		OpenGL.rotate pitch (OpenGL.Vector3 1 0 (0::OpenGL.GLfloat))
		OpenGL.rotate yaw (OpenGL.Vector3 0 1 (0::OpenGL.GLfloat))
		OpenGL.currentColor OpenGL.$= (OpenGL.Color4 1 1 1 1)
		OpenGL.renderPrimitive OpenGL.Triangles $ mapM_ OpenGL.vertex
			([
				(OpenGL.Vertex3 0 0 0),
				(OpenGL.Vertex3 0 1 0),
				(OpenGL.Vertex3 1 0 0)
			]::[OpenGL.Vertex3 OpenGL.GLfloat])
	OpenGL.currentColor OpenGL.$= (OpenGL.Color4 0 1 0 0.5)
	OpenGL.renderPrimitive OpenGL.Quads $ let
		vertex3f x y z = OpenGL.vertex (OpenGL.Vertex3 x y z :: OpenGL.Vertex3 OpenGL.GLfloat)
		texCoord2f x y = OpenGL.texCoord (OpenGL.TexCoord2 x y :: OpenGL.TexCoord2 OpenGL.GLfloat)
		in do
			texCoord2f 0 0
			vertex3f (-1) (-1) 0
			texCoord2f 1 0
			vertex3f 1 (-1) 0
			texCoord2f 1 1
			vertex3f 1 1 0
			texCoord2f 0 1
			vertex3f (-1) 1 0
	SDL.glSwapBuffers
