title: hairy wheres
contents:
expressionList :: Parser [NativeLangExpression]
expressionList = do
    many $ symbol ";"
    exps <- maybeEof $ semiColonSep (fmap Left assignment <|> fmap Right expression)
    return $ unroll exps
    where
    assignment = try $ do
        lhs <- identifier
        symbol ":="
        rhs <- expression
        return (lhs, rhs)
    unroll [] = []
    unroll (Right exp:xs) = (exp:unroll xs)
    unroll (Left (lhs, rhs):xs) = [mkCall CPrim sub "" [rhs]]
        where
        sub = ELit . toNative $ mkSub [lhs] (unroll xs)
    maybeEof p = do
        exps <- p
        do { eof; return (exps ++ [Right ESaveContinuation]) } <|> return exps

main = openDisplay "" >>= main'
main' dpy = do grabK "F1"
               grabB button1
               allocaXEvent body
    where root = defaultRootWindow dpy
          modMask = mod1Mask
          grabK k = do k <- keysymToKeycode dpy $ stringToKeysym k
                       grabKey dpy k modMask root True grabModeAsync grabModeAsync
          grabB b = grabButton dpy b modMask root True buttonPressMask grabModeAsync grabModeAsync none none
          grabP w = grabPointer dpy w True evMask grabModeAsync grabModeAsync none none currentTime
              where evMask = pointerMotionMask -- .|. buttonReleaseMask
          body ev = do nextEvent dpy ev
                       get_EventType ev >>= dispatch
                       body ev  -- endlessly repeat
              where dispatch t | t == keyPress = get_KeyEvent ev >>= onK
                               | t == buttonPress = get_ButtonEvent ev >>= onB
                    onK (_,w,_,_,_,_,_,_,_,_) | w /= none = raiseWindow dpy w
                    onB (_,w,_,_,_,_,_,_,_,_) 
                        | w /= none = grabP w >> return ()

title: procedure documentation
contents:
;;; @deffn Message add-value-slot! getter value
;;; @deffnx Message add-value-slot! getter setter value
;;;
;;; Add a new value slot to the recipient. The value of the slot can
;;; be retrieved with the @var{getter} message. If a @var{setter} is
;;; given, that message can be used to change the value of the slot.
;;; @end deffn
(define add-value-slot!
  (case-lambda
   ((self resend getter value)
    (let ((slot (make-prometheus-mutable-slot getter #f value 'value)))
      (self 'delete-slot! getter)
      (add-mutable-slot! self getter slot)
      (resend #f 'add-slot! getter (lambda (self resend)
                                     value))))
   ((self resend getter setter value)
    (let ((slot (make-prometheus-mutable-slot getter setter value 'value)))
      (self 'delete-slot! getter)
      (self 'delete-slot! setter)
      (add-mutable-slot! self getter slot)
      (resend #f 'add-slot! getter
              (lambda (self resend)
                (slot-value slot)))
      (resend #f 'add-slot! setter
              (lambda (new-self resend new-value)
                (if (eq? new-self self)
                    (set-slot-value! slot new-value)
                    (new-self 'add-value-slot! getter setter new-value))))))))

title: vlad and cworth talk about device offsets

Mar 09 13:42:43 <vlad_> cworth: ping
Mar 09 13:43:11 <--     ifoox has quit ("Leaving")
Mar 09 13:43:42 <cworth>        vlad_: pong
Mar 09 13:44:49 <vlad_> I'm looking at your device-offsets branch, poking at glyphs
Mar 09 13:45:15 <vlad_> I think the SURFACE_TO_BACKEND/BACKEND_TO_SURFACE macros are wrong
Mar 09 13:45:32 <vlad_> (I think you're using the ones I switched to, I may have gotten them backwards)
Mar 09 13:45:46 <vlad_> with a device_x_offset of 25
Mar 09 13:45:52 <vlad_> and a surface coord of 0
Mar 09 13:45:58 <vlad_> the backend coord should be 25, no?
Mar 09 13:46:41 <vlad_> yeah, switching those makes show_glyphs work
Mar 09 13:46:56 <vlad_> let me look at the other uses
Mar 09 13:47:29 <cworth>        vlad_: Good. That's what I said yesterday.
Mar 09 13:47:40 <cworth>        vlad_: But I just hadn't pushed the changes, since I wanted to be sure.
Mar 09 13:48:07 <cworth>        vlad_: I just pushed something like 4 commits. Take a look.
Mar 09 13:48:16 <vlad_> ah, great
Mar 09 13:48:30 <cworth>        vlad_: The first reverses the macros, and subsequent ones reverse some of the users.
Mar 09 13:48:44 <vlad_> yeah, that sounds right
Mar 09 13:48:54 <cworth>        (Specifically, show_glyphs and mark_dirty).
Mar 09 13:49:32 <vlad_> yeah, looks like I managed to utterly confuse myself when I flipped those macros, apparently :)
Mar 09 13:49:40 <cworth>        vlad_: Hehe.
Mar 09 13:49:59 <cworth>        vlad_: Oddly enough, in my current tree there are no users of BACKEND_TO_SURFACE at all.
Mar 09 13:50:17 <vlad_> shouldn't _extents use it?
Mar 09 13:50:39 <vlad_> but extents is weird, isn't it
Mar 09 13:51:04 <vlad_> since it's returning 0,0,w,h and we want 25,25,w-25,h-25
Mar 09 13:51:12 <vlad_> not -25,-25,w,h
Mar 09 13:51:25 <cworth>        vlad_: The current version of extents gives the right result, but the naming of SURFACE_TO_BACKEND definitely looks very weird there.
Mar 09 13:51:35 <vlad_> yeah.. I don't think we should use SURFACE_TO_BACKEND_* there, but should write it out with a comment
Mar 09 13:51:51 <cworth>        vlad_: That's what gave me pause before I committed this stuff last night.
Mar 09 13:52:01 <cworth>        vlad_: That's a good idea.
Mar 09 13:52:31 <vlad_> also maybe update the doc comment for _extents.. since it's not exactly right that it's the "region beyond which no rendering will possibly be recorded"
Mar 09 13:53:00 <vlad_> it still seems more correct for it to return -25,-25,w,h
Mar 09 13:53:52 <cworth>        vlad_: Oh, device scaling isn't even being used currently. (Which isn't too surprising since I was pretty sure there are aspects of the current handling that are totally wrong.)
Mar 09 13:53:57 <--     jghali has quit (Nick collision from services.)
Mar 09 13:54:03 -->     jghali (i=jghali@ANantes-251-1-60-246.w81-53.abo.wanadoo.fr) has joined #cairo
Mar 09 13:55:05 -->     muntyan (n=muntyan@pool-71-113-224-59.herntx.dsl-w.verizon.net) has joined #cairo
Mar 09 13:56:25 <vlad_> you've got stray dev_interest_rect stuff still in dest_image
Mar 09 13:56:48 <vlad_> (and in release)
Mar 09 13:56:53 <--     muntyan (n=muntyan@pool-71-113-224-59.herntx.dsl-w.verizon.net) has left #cairo ("Leaving")
Mar 09 13:56:55 <cworth>        vlad_: Well, it depends. The larger -25,-25,w,h result is easy to specify, (the extents of the backend 'thingy' expressed in surface space), but I don't think we ever actually want that. We always want the smaller thing since we use get_extents to decide where to paint and where to clip, right?
Mar 09 13:57:10 <cworth>        vlad_: Yeah, would help if I actually tried to compile this...
Mar 09 13:57:26 -->     kig_ (n=kig@hoas-fe35dd00-111.dhcp.inet.fi) has joined #cairo
Mar 09 13:57:27 <vlad_> yeah, it just makes the extents sound weird.. since you can draw outside of that region
Mar 09 13:57:35 <vlad_> but maybe that's just a documentation thing.. esp. since we don't expose extents()
Mar 09 13:57:55 <vlad_> lots of things passing with this now
Mar 09 13:58:21 <cworth>        vlad_: Yeah, should be really close. And I think I know how to fix self-copy too.
Mar 09 13:58:48 <cworth>        vlad_: I'm going to rollback those last two commits and fix them properly, so wait for that before you start branching off of my stuff or anything.
Mar 09 14:00:51 <vlad_> k

# $Id$
PortSystem		1.0
name			jlj
version			2.12
categories		net
maintainers		mstevens@etla.org
description		A livejournal client
long_description  JLJ is a command-line interface for posting to \
				  livejournal. Posts are edited in your default editor.
homepage		  http://patsy.cis.rit.edu/Software/perl/
master_sites	  http://patsy.cis.rit.edu/Software/perl/
distfiles		  jlj_2.12.tar.gz
checksums		  md5 55724c4d6d26211f34803ef856075234
depends_lib       bin:perl:perl5.8
configure		  {}
build			  {}
worksrcdir        jlj
post-configure	  {
	reinplace "s|\/usr\/bin\/perl|${prefix}\/bin\/perl|" \
		"${workpath}/jlj/jlj.pl"
}
destroot.cmd      true
post-destroot     {
	system "mkdir -p ${destroot}${prefix}/bin"
	system " cp ${workpath}/jlj/jlj.pl ${destroot}${prefix}/bin/jlj"
	system "mkdir -p ${destroot}${prefix}/share/doc/${name}_${version}"
	system "cp ${workpath}/jlj/README.JLJ ${destroot}${prefix}/share/doc/${name}_${version}"
	system "mkdir -p ${destroot}/${prefix}/share/examples/${name}_${version}"
	system "cp ${workpath}/jlj/.livejournal.rc ${destroot}${prefix}/share/examples/${name}_${version}/livejournal.rc"
}

Hairy intrinsic
contents:
\ type [
    <label> "f" set
    <label> "end" set
    ! Get the tag
    "obj" operand "y" operand tag-mask ANDI
    ! Tag the tag
    "y" operand "x" operand tag-fixnum
    ! Compare with object tag number (3).
    0 "y" operand object-tag CMPI
    ! Jump if the object doesn't store type info in its header
    "end" get BNE
    ! It does store type info in its header
    ! Is the pointer itself equal to 3? Then its F_TYPE (9).
    0 "obj" operand object-tag CMPI
    "f" get BEQ
    ! The pointer is not equal to 3. Load the object header.
    "x" operand "obj" operand object-tag neg LWZ
    "x" operand dup untag
    "end" get B
    "f" get save-xt
    ! The pointer is equal to 3. Load F_TYPE (9).
    f type tag-bits shift "x" operand LI
    "end" get save-xt
    "obj" operand "x" operand MR
] H{
    { +input { { f "obj" } } }
    { +scratch { { f "x" } { f "y" } } }
    { +output { "obj" } }
} define-intrinsic

title: Compiler backend protocol
contents:
IN: compiler
USING: generic kernel kernel-internals math memory namespaces
sequences ;

! A scratch register for computations
TUPLE: vreg n ;

! Register classes
TUPLE: int-regs ;
TUPLE: float-regs size ;

! A pseudo-register class for parameters spilled on the stack
TUPLE: stack-params ;

! Return values of this class go here
GENERIC: return-reg ( register-class -- reg )

! Sequence of registers used for parameter passing in class
GENERIC: fastcall-regs ( register-class -- regs )

! Sequence mapping vreg-n to native assembler registers
DEFER: vregs ( -- regs )

! Load a literal (immediate or indirect)
G: load-literal ( obj vreg -- ) 1 standard-combination ;

! Set up caller stack frame (PowerPC and AMD64)
: %prologue ( n -- ) drop ;

! Tear down stack frame (PowerPC and AMD64)
: %epilogue ( n -- ) drop ;

! Tail call another word
DEFER: %jump ( label -- )

! Call another word
DEFER: %call ( label -- )

! Local jump for branches or tail calls in nested #label
DEFER: %jump-label ( label -- )

! Test if vreg is 'f' or not
DEFER: %jump-t ( label vreg -- )

! Jump table of addresses (one cell each) is right after this
DEFER: %dispatch ( vreg -- )

! Return to caller
DEFER: %return ( -- )

! Change datastack height
DEFER: %inc-d ( n -- )

! Change callstack height
DEFER: %inc-r ( n -- )

! Load stack into vreg
DEFER: %peek ( vreg loc -- )

! Store vreg to stack
DEFER: %replace ( vreg loc -- )

! FFI stuff
DEFER: %unbox ( n reg-class func -- )

DEFER: %unbox-struct ( n reg-class size -- )

DEFER: %box ( n reg-class func -- )

DEFER: %box-struct ( n reg-class size -- )

DEFER: %alien-invoke ( library function -- )

DEFER: %alien-callback ( quot -- )

DEFER: %callback-value ( reg-class func -- )

! A few FFI operations have default implementations
: %cleanup ( n -- ) drop ;

: %stack>freg ( n reg reg-class -- ) 3drop ;

: %freg>stack ( n reg reg-class -- ) 3drop ;

! Some stuff probably not worth redefining in other backends
M: stack-params fastcall-regs drop 0 ;

GENERIC: reg-size ( register-class -- n )

GENERIC: inc-reg-class ( register-class -- )

M: int-regs reg-size drop cell ;

: (inc-reg-class)
    dup class inc
    macosx? [ reg-size stack-params +@ ] [ drop ] if ;

M: int-regs inc-reg-class
    (inc-reg-class) ;

M: float-regs reg-size float-regs-size ;

M: float-regs inc-reg-class
    dup (inc-reg-class)
    macosx? [ reg-size 4 / int-regs +@ ] [ drop ] if ;

GENERIC: v>operand

M: integer v>operand tag-bits shift ;

M: vreg v>operand vreg-n vregs nth ;

M: f v>operand address ;

title: pjb-asm7090
contents:
;;****************************************************************************
;;FILE:               7090.el
;;LANGUAGE:           emacs lisp
;;SYSTEM:             POSIX
;;USER-INTERFACE:     NONE
;;DESCRIPTION
;;    
;;    asm7090 stuff.
;;    
;;AUTHORS
;;    <PJB> Pascal Bourguignon <pjb@informatimago.com>
;;MODIFICATIONS
;;    2005-06-04 <PJB> Created.
;;BUGS
;;LEGAL
;;    GPL
;;    
;;    Copyright Pascal Bourguignon 2005 - 2005
;;    
;;    This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
;;    modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License
;;    as published by the Free Software Foundation; either version
;;    2 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.
;;    
;;    This program is distributed in the hope that it will be
;;    useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied
;;    warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR
;;    PURPOSE.  See the GNU General Public License for more details.
;;    
;;    You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public
;;    License along with this program; if not, write to the Free
;;    Software Foundation, Inc., 59 Temple Place, Suite 330,
;;    Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA
;;****************************************************************************

(require 'pjb-cl)
(defvar font-lock-keywords)

;; ASM 7090 mode

(defconst +asm7090-ibsys-char+   ?$)
(defconst +asm7090-comment-char+ ?*)
(defconst +space+                32)


(defun POSITION-IF (item sequence &rest keys)
  ;; (message "item=%S seq=%S keys=%S"  item sequence keys)
  (let ((start (getf keys :start))
        (end   (getf keys :end)))
    (cond
     ((and start (= start (length sequence))) nil)
     ((and end (< (length sequence) end))
      (setf keys (copy-seq keys))
      (setf (getf keys :end) (length sequence))
      (apply (function position-if) item sequence keys))
     (t
      (apply (function position-if) item sequence keys)))))


;; (defun POSITION (item sequence &rest keys)
;;   (message "item=%S seq=%S keys=%S"  item sequence keys)
;;   (apply (function position) item sequence keys))


(defun search-asm7090-fields (limit)
  (macrolet ((sel (len min max sma bet big)
                  (let ((vlen (gensym)) (vmin (gensym)) (vmax (gensym)))
                    `(let ((,vlen ,len) (,vmin ,min) (,vmax ,max))
                       (cond ((< ,vlen ,min)  ,sma)
                             ((<= ,vlen ,max) ,bet)
                             (t               ,big))))))
    (let* ((start (progn (beginning-of-line) (point)))
           (end   (progn (end-of-line)       (point)))
           (line (buffer-substring-no-properties start end)))
      ;; (message "search-asm7090-fields %d %S\n%S" (point) limit line)
      ;; (message "search-asm7090-fields start=%d  end=%d\n" start end)
      (setf limit (1+ end))
      (beginning-of-line) 
      (cond
       ((= 0 (length line))
        ;; (message "  exit 0")
        (re-search-forward 
         "^\\(\\)\\(\\)\\(\\)\\(\\)\\(\\)\\(\\)\n" limit t))
       ((= (aref line 0) +asm7090-ibsys-char+)
        ;; (message "  exit 1")
        (re-search-forward 
         "^\\(\\)\\(\\)\\(\\)\\(\\)\\(.\\{1,72\\}\\)\\(.\\{0,8\\}\\)\n" limit t))
       ((= (aref line 0) +asm7090-comment-char+)
        ;; (message "  exit 2")
        (re-search-forward 
         "^\\(\\)\\(\\)\\(\\)\\(.\\{1,72\\}\\)\\(\\)\\(.\\{0,8\\}\\)\n" limit t))
       ((re-search-forward              ; only spaces
         "^ +\\(\\)\\(\\)\\(\\)\\(\\)\\(\\)\\(\\)\n" limit t))
       ;; (message "  exit 3") t
       ((< (length line) 7)
        ;; (message "  exit 4")
        (re-search-forward 
         "^\\(.\\{0,6\\}\\)\\(\\)\\(\\)\\(\\)\\(\\)\\(\\)\n" limit t))
       (t (let ((labs 0) (labe 6)
                cods code
                args arge
                coms come
                nums nume)
            ;; (message "  exit 5")
            (setf cods (POSITION-IF (lambda (ch) (/= ch +space+)) line
                                    :start 6 :end 15))
            ;; (message "cods=%S" cods)
            (if cods
              (setf code (min 72 (or (POSITION +space+ line :start cods)
                                     (length line))))
              (setf cods 6
                    code 6))
            ;; (message "cods=%S code=%S" cods code)
            (setf args (POSITION-IF (lambda (ch) (/= ch +space+)) line
                                    :start code :end 16))
            ;; (message "args=%S" args)
            (if args
              (setf args (min 72 args)
                    arge (min 72 (or (POSITION +space+ line :start args)
                                     (length line))))
              (setf args code
                    arge code))
            ;; (message "OPCODE= %S"(subseq line cods code))
            (when (STRING-EQUAL (subseq line cods code) "BCI")
              (let* ((comma (POSITION (CHARACTER ",") line
                                      :start args :end arge))
                     (size  (HANDLER-CASE
                                (parse-integer line args
                                               (min arge (or comma arge)))
                              (error () nil))))
                ;; (message "SIZE=%S" size)
                (when (and comma size)
                  (setf arge (min 72 (+ comma 1 (* 6 size)) (length line))))))
            ;; (message "args=%S arge=%S" args arge)
            (setf coms (POSITION-IF (lambda (ch) (/= ch +space+)) line
                                    :start arge))
            ;; (message "coms=%S" coms)
            (if coms
              (setf coms (min 72 coms)
                    come (min 72 (length line)))
              (setf coms arge
                    come arge))
            ;; (message "coms=%S come=%S" coms come)
            (if (<= 72 (length line))
              (setf nums 72
                    nume (min 80 (length line)))
              (setf nums (length line)
                    nume (length line)))
            ;; (message "nums=%S nume=%S" nums nume)
            (prog1
                (re-search-forward
                 (apply (function concat)
                        (list "^"
                              (format "\\(.\\{%d\\}\\)" (- labe labs))
                              (format " \\{%d\\}"       (- cods labe))
                              (format "\\(.\\{%d\\}\\)" (- code cods))
                              (format " \\{%d\\}"       (- args code))
                              (format "\\(.\\{%d\\}\\)" (- arge args))
                              (format " \\{%d\\}"       (- coms arge))
                              (format "\\(.\\{%d\\}\\)" (- come coms))
                              (format " \\{%d\\}"       (- nums come))
                              "\\(\\)"  ; IBSYS
                              (format "\\(.\\{%d\\}\\)" (- nume nums))
                              "\n"))
                 limit t)
              (when nil
                (message "line=%S\nlabel=%3d %S\nopcod=%3d %S\nargum=%3d %S\ncomnt=%3d %S\nibsys=%3d %S\nnmber=%3d %S\n"
                         line
                         (length (match-string-no-properties 1))
                         (match-string-no-properties 1)
                         (length (match-string-no-properties 2))
                         (match-string-no-properties 2)
                         (length (match-string-no-properties 3))
                         (match-string-no-properties 3)
                         (length (match-string-no-properties 4))
                         (match-string-no-properties 4)
                         (length (match-string-no-properties 5))
                         (match-string-no-properties 5)
                         (length (match-string-no-properties 6))
                         (match-string-no-properties 6)))
              )))))))


(defun split-asm7090-fields ()
  (interactive)
  (search-asm7090-fields (point-max))
  (message "label=%3d %S\nopcod=%3d %S\nargum=%3d %S\ncomnt=%3d %S\nibsys=%3d %S\nnmber=%3d %S\n"
           (length (match-string-no-properties 1))
           (match-string-no-properties 1)
           (length (match-string-no-properties 2))
           (match-string-no-properties 2)
           (length (match-string-no-properties 3))
           (match-string-no-properties 3)
           (length (match-string-no-properties 4))
           (match-string-no-properties 4)
           (length (match-string-no-properties 5))
           (match-string-no-properties 5)
           (length (match-string-no-properties 6))
           (match-string-no-properties 6)))
  

(defun asm7090-font-lock ()
  (interactive)
  (setq font-lock-defaults nil
        font-lock-keywords nil)
  (font-lock-add-keywords 
   nil
   (list
    (list
     (function search-asm7090-fields)
     '(1 font-lock-function-name-face)       ; labels
     '(2 font-lock-keyword-face)             ; operation codes
     '(3 font-lock-reference-face)           ; arguments
     '(4 font-lock-comment-face)             ; comments
     '(5 font-lock-preprocessor-face)        ; ibsys
     '(6 font-lock-type-face)                ; cols 72-80
     ))))

(defun asm7090-show-codop-description (codop)
  (let ((desc (find-if (lambda (desc) (STRING-EQUAL (first desc) codop))
                       +codop-7090+)))
    (message (if desc
               (format "%s: %s" (first desc) (find-if (function stringp) desc))
               (format "%s: unknown" (first desc))))))


(defun asm7090-describe-codop ()
  (interactive)
  (save-excursion
    (beginning-of-line)
    (search-asm7090-fields (save-excursion (forward-line 1) (point)))
    (asm7090-show-codop-description (match-string-no-properties 2))))


(defun asm7090 ()
  (interactive)
  (asm7090-font-lock)
  (make-local-variable 'tab-stop-list)
  (setf tab-stop-list     '(0 7 15 34 72)
        asm-comment-char   ?*)
  (local-set-key [tab] (function tab-to-tab-stop))
  (local-set-key "" (lambda ()
                         (interactive) 
                         (asm7090-describe-codop) 
                         (newline-and-indent)))
  (message "asm7090 activated"))

title: JLPostgres.h
Layer coordinates to popup window
contents:
;; -*-scheme-*- 

(define (script-fu-layer-coordinates image drawable)
  (let* (
		(clayer (gimp-image-get-active-layer image))
		(coords (gimp-drawable-offsets drawable))
		(bredde (car(gimp-drawable-width drawable)))
		(hoyde (car(gimp-drawable-height drawable)))
		(offsx (car coords))
		(offsy (cadr coords))
		)
		
		(begin
		(gimp-image-undo-group-start image)
		(gimp-message 
		(string-append "(left top width height) = " 
		(number->string offsx) " " 
		(number->string offsy) " " 
		(number->string car(bredde)) " " 
		(number->string car(hoyde))))
		(gimp-image-undo-group-end image)
		(gimp-displays-flush)
		)
	)
)


(script-fu-register "script-fu-layer-coordinates"
			_"Selection _Coordinates"
			_"Displays bounding box (left,top,width,height) of current selection."
			"Paul Stolen, 2006."
			"Modified version of a script by Noel Burton-Krahn, 2005.  Public Domain."
			"2005-11-30"
		    ""
			SF-IMAGE "Image" 0 
			SF-DRAWABLE "Drawable" 0)

(script-fu-menu-register "script-fu-layer-coordinates"
			"<Image>/Layer")

title: catching
contents:
let rec split' offset s c =
  match catch (String.index_from s offset c) with
      Result idx ->
        let len = idx - offset in
        let s'  = String.sub s offset len in
          s' :: (split' (succ idx) s c)
    | Error Not_found ->
        [ String.sub s offset (String.length s - offset) ]
    | Error e -> raise e

title: ExprParser.hs
contents:
module ExprParser (whiteExpr) where
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
--               2D1456, Advanced Functional Programming                    --
--               Mini project: P1.2 Symbolic Integration                    --
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
--               Author: Alfonso Acosta Gómez                               --
--               Date:   March-May 2006                                     --
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-- Description: Toy symbolic simplifier based on the Lisp code included in  -- 
--              Chapter 8 from:                                             --
--               Norvig, "Paradigms of Artificial Intelligence Programming: --
--               Case Studies in Common Lisp", Morgan Kaufmann              --
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-- Module: ExprParser.hs, Parses an expresion writtn in text                --
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
--  This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify    --
--  it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by    --
--  the Free Software Foundation; version 2 of the License.                 --
--                                                                          --
--  This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,         --
--  but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of          --
--  MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the           --
--  GNU General Public License for more details.                            --
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
import Expr
import Text.ParserCombinators.Parsec
import Text.ParserCombinators.Parsec.Expr
import Text.ParserCombinators.Parsec.Token
import Text.ParserCombinators.Parsec.Language (emptyDef)



lang :: TokenParser st
-- Language token parser: permits removing spaces (no newlines) easily
lang  = makeTokenParser emptyDef


-- FIXME: force a separator between symbols  
-- FIXME: things such us "vaadad" shouldn't be parsed

whiteExpr :: CharParser st Expr
-- parses an expression without white spaces at the begining
whiteExpr = do whiteSpace lang
               expr
               

expr :: CharParser st Expr
-- Expression parser
expr    = buildExpressionParser table factor
         <?> "expression"

table :: [[Operator Char st Expr]]
-- Table of operands, for some reason in Norvigs book the operands
-- are Right associative and "/" has a higher precedence than "*"
-- (same goes with "-" and "+")
table = [map (\str -> prefix str (Func str)) functions         -- functions
          ,[prefix "-" Negate, prefix "+" id]                  -- unary opers
          ,[op "^" consExp AssocRight]                         -- exponent
          ,[op "/" (:/:) AssocRight],[op "*" (:*:) AssocRight] -- / *
          ,[op "-" (:-:) AssocRight],[op "+" (:+:) AssocRight] -- - +
         ]
         where
           op s f assoc
              = Infix (do{ symbol lang s; return f} <?> "operator") assoc
           prefix s f = Prefix (do{try(symbol lang s); return f}<?> "operator")
           consExp lhs rhs = lhs :^: (expr2rhsExp rhs)              
          
                  
functions :: [String]
-- List of valid function identifiers
functions = ["log","exp","sin","cos","tan","sinh","cosh","tanh"]

cSymbols :: [String]
-- List of valid constant symbols
cSymbols = ["e","pi"] 

parseCSymbols :: GenParser Char st Expr
-- parser of valid constant symbols
parseCSymbols = choice (map parseOne cSymbols) 
  where parseOne str = do{symbol lang str; return (CSym str)} <?> "csymbol"


parseVar :: GenParser Char st Expr
parseVar = do {c <- lexeme lang letter; return (Var c)}


parseD :: GenParser Char st Expr
-- Parse a Derivative expression (D (cos x) x)
parseD = parseBinary "D" D 

parseI :: GenParser Char st Expr
-- Parse an Integral expression (for example "I (sin x) x")
parseI = parseBinary "I" I 

parseBinary :: String -> (Expr -> Char -> Expr) -> GenParser Char st Expr
-- Parse binary functions of the type "s expression variable"
-- Used for parsing derivatives (D expr var) and integrals (I expr var)
parseBinary s f = do symbol lang s
                     e <- expr
                     c <- lexeme lang letter
                     return (f e c)
 



factor :: GenParser Char st Expr
-- Parser of a terms included in an expression
factor  =    -- an expression between parens
             parens lang expr
             -- a constant symbol
         <|> parseCSymbols
             -- an integral or a derivative
         <|> parseI <|> parseD
             -- a variable 
         <|> parseVar
             -- a number
         <|> do {e <- naturalOrFloat lang; return (either2const e)}
         <?> "subexpression"

either2const :: Either Integer Double -> Expr
-- transform an either expression into a constant
either2const (Left i)  = Const (fromInteger i)
either2const (Right d) = Const (realToFrac d)

title: Expr.hs
contents:
module Expr (Expr (..), RhsExp (..), freeOf, freeOfList, rhsExp2Expr, 
             expr2rhsExp, isConst, notConst, factorize, unfactorize, querep) 
where
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
--               2D1456, Advanced Functional Programming                    --
--               Mini project: P1.2 Symbolic Integration                    --
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
--               Author: Alfonso Acosta Gómez                               --
--               Date:   March-May 2006                                     --
--               e-mail: alfonso.acosta@gmail.com                           --
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-- Description: Toy symbolic integrator based on the Lisp code included in  -- 
--              Chapter 8 from:                                             --
--               Norvig, "Paradigms of Artificial Intelligence Programming: --
--               Case Studies in Common Lisp", Morgan Kaufmann              --
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-- Module: Expr.hs,Type and aux functions to represent symbolic expressions --
------------------------------------------------------------------------------

import Maybe

-- Expr: A type to internally represent symbolic expressions 
-- (using infix constructors)

-- I first tried to make Expresions polymorphic (i.e. data Num a =>
-- Exp a = ... | Const a | ...)  but due to the hard typing of Haskell
-- it leaded to so may problems (see the operator ^^, for example)
-- that I had to stick to Fractionals. The polymorfism wasn't then so
-- wide, and to simplify it (and avoid to type the polymorphic
-- parameter all the time), I decided to use Floats

data Expr = 
              -- Variables and Constants
              Var Char | Const Float | 
              -- Binary operators (using infix constructors)
              Expr :+: Expr  | Expr  :-: Expr  |
              Expr :*: Expr  | Expr  :/: Expr  |
              Expr :^: RhsExp |
              -- Unary operators
              Negate Expr |
              -- Functions
              -- e.g. sin(x) is internally represented as Func "sin" (Var 'x')
              Func String Expr |
              -- Integrals and Derivatives
              -- i.e: integral(x,x) => I (Var 'x') 'x'
              I Expr Char | D Expr Char |
              -- Constant symbols such as pi, e ...
              CSym String |
              -- Undefined valude
              Undefined

  deriving Eq

-- RhsExp: Right Hand Side of Exponentation
data RhsExp = RhsExp Expr | ExpConst Int 
  deriving Eq


-- Only Integral constants are valid as an exponent
--  (We could have used (Integral b) => Expr b, where b would 
--   be the type of the constant exponent, but I stick to Int to make
--   the code more readable)

-- Note that it would be allowed to have an internal representation such as
-- Const 1.0 :^: (RhsExp (Const 2.1)), but it would be incorrect
-- TODO: To be honest, I didn't find a good way to avoid that 

-- Operand associativity and precedence following Norvig's (strange) convention

-- I,D, and functions have precedence 10
--negate has precedence 9
infixr 8 :^:
infixr 7 :/:
infixr 6 :*:
infixr 5 :-:
infixr 4 :+:


showsPrecInfix c d a op b = showParen (d>c) $
                            showsPrec (c+1) a . 
                            showString (" "++op++" ") .
                            showsPrec (c+1) b 


instance Show Expr where
-- Pretty print an expression
-- unfortunately showsPrec can't eliminate brackets due to associavity
-- a more sohpisticate prettyprint library would be required in order
-- to do that
 showsPrec d (Var x) = showChar x 
 showsPrec d (Const x) = shows x  
 showsPrec d (a :+: b) = showsPrecInfix 4 d a "+" b   
 showsPrec d (a :-: b) = showsPrecInfix 5 d a "-" b   
 showsPrec d (a :*: b) = showsPrecInfix 6 d a "*" b
 showsPrec d (a :/: b)   = showsPrecInfix 7 d a "/" b
 showsPrec d (a :^: b)   = showsPrecInfix 8 d a "^" b
 showsPrec d (Negate a)  = showParen (d>9)$ 
                           showString "- " . showsPrec (10) a
 showsPrec d (Func str expr) = showParen (d>10)$
                               showString (str++" ") . showsPrec 11 expr
 showsPrec d (I expr x)  = showParen (d>10)$
                               showString "I " . showsPrec 11 expr. 
                               showString " ". showChar x
 showsPrec d (D expr x)  = showParen (d>10)$
                               showString "D " . showsPrec 11 expr. 
                               showString " ". showChar x
 showsPrec d (CSym str)  = showString str
 showsPrec d Undefined   = showString "undefined"




instance Show RhsExp where
 showsPrec d (RhsExp expr) = showsPrec d expr 
 showsPrec _ (ExpConst c)  = shows c  


-- We can interestingly make Expr an instance of Num
-- (which is going to be useful later)
instance Num Expr where
 negate e = Negate e
 e1 - e2  = e1 :-: e2
 e1 + e2  = e1 :+: e2
 e1 * e2  = e1 :*: e2
 abs (Const a)  = Const (abs a)
 abs (Negate a) = a
 abs e          = Func "abs" e
 fromInteger i  = Const (fromInteger i)
 signum = (\_ -> error "Signum doesn't apply to expressions") 

---------------------
-- Auxiliar functions
---------------------

-- We can also create a fold operation for the expressions
-- but we need a different function for every non ending node
-- The fold expression might be too difficult then.
-- See as an example http://haskell.org/hawiki/WhatIsaFold

-- foldExpr :: 


freeOf :: Expr -> Char -> Bool
-- Tells if an expresions is free of certain variable
-- (designated by a char)
freeOf (Var x) y = x /= y
freeOf (Const _) y = True   
freeOf (CSym  _) y = True
freeOf Undefined _ = True
freeOf (l :+: r) y = freeOf l y && freeOf r y  
freeOf (l :-: r) y = freeOf l y && freeOf r y  
freeOf (l :*: r) y = freeOf l y && freeOf r y  
freeOf (l :/: r) y = freeOf l y && freeOf r y  
freeOf (l :^: (RhsExp r)) y = freeOf l y && freeOf r y  
freeOf (l :^: (ExpConst _)) y = freeOf l y
freeOf (Negate x) y = freeOf x y 
freeOf (Func _ x) y = freeOf x y
freeOf (I    x _) y = freeOf x y
freeOf (D    x _) y = freeOf x y

freeOfList :: [Expr] -> Char -> Bool
freeOfList el x = and ((map ((flip freeOf) x)) el) 





-- Functions to convert a RhsExp  to and from an Expr
rhsExp2Expr :: RhsExp -> Expr
rhsExp2Expr (RhsExp e)   = e
rhsExp2Expr (ExpConst n) = Const (fromIntegral n)

expr2rhsExp :: Expr -> RhsExp  
expr2rhsExp (Const n) 
  | b /= 0    = error "non-Integer exponent"
  | otherwise = ExpConst a
        where (a,b) = properFraction n  
expr2rhsExp expr      = RhsExp expr



isConst :: Expr -> Bool
-- Tells if a expression is a constant
isConst (Const _) = True
isConst _         = False

notConst :: Expr -> Bool
notConst = not.isConst


factorize :: Expr -> [Expr]
-- Given an expression, it returns its list of factors,
-- Each of those factors will have the form (Exp a) :^: Const a
factorize exp 
   | mconst == fromInteger 0 = 
     [(Const (fromInteger 0)) :^: (ExpConst (fromInteger 1))]
   | mconst == fromInteger 1 =  factors
   | otherwise = ((Const mconst) :^: (ExpConst (fromInteger 1))) : factors
     where (factors, mconst, _) = fac exp ([], 1.0, 1) 




fac :: Expr -> ([Expr], Float, Int) -> ([Expr], Float, Int)
-- Auxiliar function to factorize
--  It takes an expresion and calculates its list of factors (without 
--  considering the multiplicative constant of the expresion)
--
--  It makes use of 3 accumulative parameters:
--    factors: List of the previously obtained factors
--    mconst:  The implicit multiplicative constant of the expression
--    exp:     The implicit numeric exponent of the expression
fac (Const c) (factors, mconst, exp)          = (factors, mconst*c^^exp, exp)
fac (lhs :*: rhs) acum@(factors, mconst, exp) = fac rhs (flhs, mclhs, exp)
  where (flhs, mclhs, _) = fac lhs acum 
fac (lhs :/: rhs) acum@(factors, mconst, exp) = fac rhs (flhs, mclhs, -exp)
  where (flhs, mclhs, _) = fac lhs acum 
fac (Negate expr) (factors, mconst, exp) = fac expr (factors, -mconst, exp) 
fac (lhs :^: (ExpConst n)) (factors, mconst, exp) = 
  fac lhs (factors, mconst, exp * n)
fac expr (factors, const, exp) = 
  if isJust factors' then (fromJust factors', const, exp)
                     else (expr :^: (ExpConst exp):factors, const, exp)
   where factors' = querep factors 
                    (\(lhs :^: _ ) -> lhs == expr)
                    (\(lhs :^: (ExpConst n)) -> lhs :^: (ExpConst (n+exp))) 
 

querep :: [a] -> (a -> Bool) -> (a -> a) -> Maybe [a]
-- Query and replace (by using `f`) the first ocurrence of the list which 
--  fullfils predicate p
-- If no element fullfills p it would return Nothing
querep [] _ _     = Nothing
querep (x:xs) p f 
  | p x        = Just ((f x):xs)
  | otherwise  = x `maycons` querep xs p f 
  where maycons _ Nothing   = Nothing
        maycons x (Just xs) = Just (x:xs) 


unfactorize :: [Expr] -> Expr
-- Creates the original expression from the factor list
unfactorize [] = (Const 1.0)
unfactorize xs = foldl1 (:*:) xs

;;; Exercise 1.
(defun tokens (str &key (test #'constituent) (start 0))
  (let ((p1 (position-if test str :start start)))
    (if p1
	(let ((p2 (position-if #'(lambda (c)
				   (not (funcall test c)))
			       str :start p1)))
	  (cons (subseq str p1 p2)
		(if p2
		    (tokens str test p2)
		    nil)))
	nil)))

(defun constituent (c)
  (and (graphic-char-p c)
       (not (char= c #\ ))))

title: merge with ediff
contents:
#!/bin/sh
# merge(1) compatible wrapper for emacs ediff

set -e
TEMP=`getopt -o AEeLpq -n merge -- "$@"`
eval set -- "$TEMP"

while true ; do
  case "$1" in
    -A) shift ;;
    -E|-e) shift ;;
    --) shift ; break ;;
    *) exit 1 ;;
  esac
done

LOCAL=$1
ANCESTOR=$2
OTHER=$3
OUTPUT=$4

if [ "$OUTPUT" ] ; then
  eval=<<END_ELISP
(ediff-merge-files-with-ancestor "$LOCAL" "$OTHER" "$ANCESTOR")
END_ELISP
else
  eval=<<END_ELISP
(ediff-merge-files-with-ancestor "$LOCAL" "$OTHER" "$ANCESTOR" nil "$OUTPUT")
END_ELISP
fi

exec emacsclient --eval=${eval}

title: variable "usage"
contents:
i wrote this macro:

(defmacro symfnlet (fndecllist &body body)
  (let ((symfnlist (mapcar #'car fndecllist)))
    `(let (,@(mapcar #'list symfnlist))
       (progn
	 ,@(loop for entry in symfnlist
	      collect `(setf (symbol-function ',entry) ,@(cdr (assoc entry fndecllist)))))
       ,@body)))

to use in following scenarios (oversimplified, just to show usage pattern):

(symfnlet ((a #'car)
	   (b #'cdr)
	   (c #'+))
  (let ((woot '(1 2 3)))
    (c (a woot) (a (b woot)))))

this, as expected and intended, expands to:

(LET ((A) (B) (C))
  (PROGN
   (SETF (SYMBOL-FUNCTION 'A) #'CAR)
   (SETF (SYMBOL-FUNCTION 'B) #'CDR)
   (SETF (SYMBOL-FUNCTION 'C) #'+))
  (LET ((WOOT '(1 2 3)))
    (C (A WOOT) (A (B WOOT)))))

But, during evaluation SBCL emits following messages:

; caught STYLE-WARNING:
;   The variable A is defined but never used.
; 
; caught STYLE-WARNING:
;   The variable B is defined but never used.
; 
; caught STYLE-WARNING:
;   The variable C is defined but never used.
; 
; compilation unit finished
;   caught 3 STYLE-WARNING conditions

What does really "variable usage" mean?

title: Toy-ish syntax implementation on lisp.
contents:
; This program tests a different kind of syntax for lisp.
; It is not complete, and the idea behind is vague and loose.
; This is neither better, it is hard to beat common lisp's original syntax in list processing.
;
; This syntax introduces next kind of things with an usual tokenizer and poorly constructed parser:
;
; comments and whitespaces are ignored, there's three type of whitespaces: ' ', '|' and newline.
; the reason why | is whitespace, it is intended to structure code human readable without highly advanced editors.
; they are not intended to write yourself, lets make emacs to do it for you. ;) (these things are handwritten, thought.)
; here's the reset -function which represents how printer should put it:
;
; (defun reset (stream)         |
; | (setq *buffer* nil         ||
; | |     *offset* 0           ||
; | |     *input-stream* stream||
; | |     *column* 0           ||
; | |     *row* 1              ))
; 
; 
; Comments are replaced by haskell-like comments, therefore using { and -, but it is no barrier from other possible uses:
;
; {- this is 
;    a multi-line -comment. -}
; 
; -- this is one liner -comment.
;
; Quote works exactly like in common lisp, notice thought, neither it barricades "'" but a little:
; '(1 2 3) => (1 2 3)
; 
; There are formations for different kind of numbers, but I did not implement a parser for them:
; 
; 01F2H -- hex
; 0101B -- binary
; 123 -- normal number
; 1.2 -- floating point number
; 
; Neither I implemented parser for '.' -thing, which works same way as in other lisp implementations:
; (cddr '(foo blaa . bleh)) => bleh
; 
; Damn poor and cheap parser...
; If you have some your own syntax which this can do, feel free to test it. :) Remember to show it to me!

(setq *tokens* nil)

(defun reset (stream)
  (setq *buffer* nil    *offset* 0      
        *input-stream* stream
        *column* 0      *row* 1))

(defun fetch ()
  (let ((s (subseq *buffer* 0 *offset*))) 
    (setf *buffer* (subseq *buffer* *offset*) *offset* 0)
    s))

(defun next ()
  (if (> (length *buffer*) *offset*)
    (progn (incf *offset*) (elt *buffer* (- *offset* 1)))
    (let ((ch (read-char *input-stream*)))
      (if (char-equal ch #\Newline)
        (progn (setq *col* 0) (incf *row*))
        (incf *column*))
      (if *buffer*
        (setf (cdr (last *buffer*)) (cons ch nil))
        (setf *buffer* (cons ch nil)))
      (next))))

(defun make-chama (character-sequence)
  (lambda () (find (next) character-sequence)))

(defun make-allma () (lambda () (next) t))

(defun make-notma (ma) (lambda () (not (funcall ma))))

(defun make-stama (ma) 
  (lambda () 
    (let ((offset *offset*)) 
      (loop while (funcall ma) do (setf offset *offset*))
      (setf *offset* offset)
      T)))

(defun make-conma (&rest mas)
  (lambda ()
    (not (dolist (ma mas) 
           (unless (funcall ma) (return t))))))

(defun make-orma (&rest mas)
  (lambda ()
    (let ((offset *offset*))
      (dolist (ma mas)
        (if (funcall ma) (return t) (setf *offset* offset))))))

(defun next-token ()
  (setf offset *offset*)
  (let ((result (dolist (i *tokens*)
                  (if (funcall (cdr i)) (return (car i)) (setf *offset* offset)))))
    (unless result (error "invalid character! ~S in c/r ~D ~D" *buffer* *column* *row*))
    (values result (fetch))))

(defmacro deftok (name syntax)
  (labels ((parse (i)
                  (if (atom i)
                    (list 'make-chama (string i))
                    (case (car i)
                      (C (cons 'make-conma 
                                (loop for x in (cdr i) collect (parse x))))
                      (OR (cons 'make-orma 
                                 (loop for x in (cdr i) collect (parse x))))
                      (* (list 'make-stama (parse (cadr i))))
                      (NOT (list 'make-notma (parse (cadr i))))
                      (ALL (list 'make-allma))))))
    `(push (cons ',name ,(parse syntax)) *tokens*)))

(deftok identifier (c "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz"
        (* "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789")))
(deftok ignore (or (c "-" "-" (* (not #\Newline)))
                   (c "{" "-" (* (not (c "-" "}"))) "-" "}")
                   (c (or " |" #\Newline) (* (or " |" #\Newline)))))
(deftok integer (c "0123456789" (* "0123456789")))
(deftok hex (c "0123456789ABCDEFabcdef" (* "0123456789ABCDEFabcdef") "Hh"))
(deftok binary (c "01" (* "01") "Bb"))
(deftok float (c "0123456789" (* "0123456789") "." (* "0123456789")))
(deftok leftparen "(")
(deftok rightparen ")")
(deftok point ".")
(deftok quote "'")

(reset *standard-input*)

(defun parse-identifier (text) (intern (string-upcase (concatenate 'string text))))

(defun parse-list ()
  (let ((list nil))
  (loop (multiple-value-bind (result text) (next-token)
          (case result
            (ignore)
            (leftparen (push (parse-list) list))
            (identifier (push (parse-identifier text) list))
            (rightparen (return (reverse list)))
            (quote (push (list 'quote (parse)) list))
            (otherwise (error "unknown token ~S with ~S" result text)))))))

(defun parse ()
  (multiple-value-bind (result text) (next-token)
    (case result
      (leftparen (parse-list))
      (identifier (parse-identifier text))
      (ignore (parse))
      (quote (list 'quote (parse)))
      (rightparen (error "lonely rigth parenthesis or quote and right parenthesis."))
      (otherwise (error "unknown token ~S with ~S" result text)))))

(loop (print (parse)))

module Main
   where

import System.Environment
import System.Cmd
import System.Console.Readline
import System.Process
import System.IO
import Control.Concurrent
import Control.Exception





main = do
-- hSetBuffering stdin LineBuffering
   args <- getArgs
   case head args of
      "record" -> record $ unwords args
      "play"   -> play $ unwords args
      _ ->   putStrLn $ unwords args

record :: String -> IO ()
record filename = do
   putStrLn "start typing script you want to put into the file:"
   contents <- getCont =<< getLine
   bracket (openFile ("/home/loki/.hai/" ++ filename) WriteMode) hClose
           (\h -> hPutStrLn h contents)

getCont "." = return ""
getCont x = do
   c <- getCont =<< getLine
   return (x ++ c)

play :: FilePath -> IO ()
play name = system("sh /home/loki/.hai/" ++ name)

title: rpn calc
contents:
;;; macro hack so procedures can be written without explicitly manipulating the stack
(define-syntax proc
  (syntax-rules ()
    ((proc () expr ...)
     (lambda (stack)
       (cons (begin expr ...) stack)))
    ((proc (arg) expr ...)
     (lambda (stack)
       (let ((arg (car stack)))
	 (cons (begin expr ...) (cdr stack)))))
    ((proc (arg args ...) expr ...)
     (lambda (stack)
       (let ((arg (car stack)))
	 ((proc (args ...) expr ...) (cdr stack)))))))

(define (eval insts)
  (car (fold (lambda (inst stack)
	       (if (symbol? inst)
		   (apply inst stack)
		   (cons inst stack)))
	     '()
	     insts)))
(define (apply name stack)
  ((cadr (assq name `((add , (proc (x y) (+ x y)))
		      (sub , (proc (x y) (- x y)))
		      (mul , (proc (x y) (* x y)))
		      (div , (proc (x y) (/ x y))))))
   stack))

(eval '(1 2 add 3 mul)) ; 9

title: scheme to bf
contents:
(display "(define b (make-vector 30000 0))(define p 0)")
(let loop ()
  (let ((c (read-char)))
    (cond ((not (eof-object? c))
	   (case c
	     ((#\>) (display "(set! p (+ p 1))"))
	     ((#\<) (display "(set! p (- p 1))"))
	     ((#\+) (display "(vector-set! b p (+ (vector-ref b p) 1))"))
	     ((#\-) (display "(vector-set! b p (- (vector-ref b p) 1))"))
	     ((#\.) (display "(write-char (integer->char (vector-ref b p)))"))
	     ((#\,) (display "(vector-set! b p (char->integer (read-char)))"))
	     ((#\[) (display "(let loop () (cond ((not (= 0 (vector-ref b p)))"))
	     ((#\]) (display "(loop))))")))
	   (loop)))))

(defun parse ()
  (multiple-value-bind (result text) (next-token)
    (case result
      (whitespace (parse))
      (identifier (intern (string-upcase (concatenate 'string text))))
      (comment (parse))
      (leftparen ... ?
      (rightparen ... ?
      (quote (list 'quote (parse)))
      (otherwise (error "unknown token ~S with data ~S" result text)))))

title: I need your opinion about this!
contents:
(setq *tokens* nil)

(defun reset (stream)
  (setq *buffer* nil    *offset* 0      
        *input-stream* stream
        *column* 0      *row* 1))

(defun fetch ()
  (let ((s (subseq *buffer* 0 *offset*))) 
    (setf *buffer* (subseq *buffer* *offset*) *offset* 0)
    s))

(defun next ()
  (if (> (length *buffer*) *offset*)
    (progn (incf *offset*) (elt *buffer* (- *offset* 1)))
    (let ((ch (read-char *input-stream*)))
      (if (char-equal ch #\Newline)
        (progn (setq *col* 0) (incf *row*))
        (incf *column*))
      (if *buffer*
        (setf (cdr (last *buffer*)) (cons ch nil))
        (setf *buffer* (cons ch nil)))
      (next))))

(defun make-chama (character-sequence)
  (lambda () (find (next) character-sequence)))

(defun make-allma () (lambda () (next) t))

(defun make-notma (ma) (lambda () (not (funcall ma))))

(defun make-stama (ma) 
  (lambda () 
    (let ((offset *offset*)) 
      (loop while (funcall ma) do (setf offset *offset*))
      (setf *offset* offset)
      T)))

(defun make-conma (&rest mas)
  (lambda ()
    (not (dolist (ma mas) 
           (unless (funcall ma) (return t))))))

(defun make-orma (&rest mas)
  (lambda ()
    (let ((offset *offset*))
      (dolist (ma mas)
        (if (funcall ma) (return t) (setf *offset* offset))))))

(defun next-token ()
  (setf offset *offset*)
  (let ((result (dolist (i *tokens*)
                  (if (funcall (cdr i)) (return (car i)) (setf *offset* offset)))))
    (unless result (error "invalid character! ~S in c/r ~D ~D" *buffer* *column* *row*))
    (list result (fetch))))

(defmacro deftok (name syntax)
  (labels ((parse (i)
                  (if (atom i)
                    (list 'make-chama (string i))
                    (case (car i)
                      ('C (cons 'make-conma 
                                (loop for x in (cdr i) collect (parse x))))
                      ('OR (cons 'make-orma 
                                 (loop for x in (cdr i) collect (parse x))))
                      ('* (list 'make-stama (parse (cadr i))))
                      ('NOT (list 'make-notma (parse (cadr i))))
                      ('ALL (list 'make-allma))))))
    `(push (cons ',name ,(parse syntax)) *tokens*)))

(deftok whitespace (or " |" #\Newline))
(deftok identifier (c "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz"
        (* "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789")))
(deftok comment (or (c "-" "-" (* (not #\Newline)))
                   (c "{" "-" (* (not (c "-" "}"))) "-" "}")))
(deftok integer (c "0123456789" (* "0123456789")))
(deftok hex (c "0123456789ABCDEFabcdef" (* "0123456789ABCDEFabcdef") "Hh"))
(deftok binary (c "01" (* "01") "Bb"))
(deftok float (c "0123456789" (* "0123456789") "." (* "0123456789")))
(deftok leftparen "(")
(deftok rightparen ")")
(deftok point ".")
(deftok quote "'")

(reset *standard-input*)

(loop (format t "~S~&" (next-token)))

(define (square x)
  (* x x))

(define (sqrt-iter guess x)
  (if (good-enough? guess x)
      guess
      (sqrt-iter (improve guess x) x)))

(define (good-enough? guess x)
  (< (abs (- (square guess) x)) 0.05))

(define (improve guess x)
  (/ (+ x guess) 2))

(defun isearch-forward-word-at-point ()
  "Search forward for word at point."
  (interactive)
  (let ((word (save-excursion
                (forward-word -1)
                (let ((beg (point)))
                  (forward-word 1)
                  (buffer-substring beg (point))))))
    (isearch-mode t nil nil nil t)
    (isearch-yank-string word)))

title: string edit distance
contents:
(let ((d (make-array (list 32 32) :element-type 'fixnum)))
  (defun levenshtein-distance (word1 word2)
    (declare (type simple-string word1 word2)
             (optimize (speed 3)))
    (let ((length1 (length word1))
          (length2 (length word2)))
      (loop for i from 0 to length1
            do (setf (aref d i 0) i))
      (loop for j from 0 to length2
            do (setf (aref d 0 j) j))
      (loop for i from 1 to length1
            do (loop for j from 1 to length2
                     as cost = (if (char= (aref word1 (1- i))
                                          (aref word2 (1- j)))
                                   0
                                   1)
                     do (setf (aref d i j)
                              (min (1+ (aref d (1- i) j))
                                   (1+ (aref d i (1- j)))
                                   (+ (aref d (1- i) (1- j)) cost)))))
      (aref d length1 length2))))

title: simple bot problem
contents:
(defpackage :testbot (:use :common-lisp :irc :cl-ppcre) (:export :start-testbot 
						       :die-testbot
						       :bot-say))
(in-package :testbot)

(defvar *connection*)
(defvar *nickname* "")
(defvar *sayings* (list "Hello there!" "How are you?" "Why?" "OK" "No" "Yes"))
(defvar *prefix* "")

(defun make-prefix (nickname)
  (format nil "^(?i)~A[,:]\\s+" nickname))

(defun random-elt (choices)
  (elt choices (random (length choices))))

(defun bot-say (channel message)
  (privmsg *connection* channel message))

(defun msg-hook (message)
  (let ((dest (if (string-equal (first (arguments message)) *nickname*)
		  (source message)
		  (first (arguments message))))
	(saying (random-elt *sayings*)))
    (if (scan *prefix* message)
	(privmsg *connection* dest (format nil "~A: ~A" (source message) saying)))))

(defun die-testbot (&optional (message "Lisp!"))
"Function to kill the bot, with optional quit message."
  (quit *connection* message))

(defun start-testbot (nick server channel)
"Function to start the bot."
  (setf *nickname* nick)
  (setf *prefix* (make-prefix *nickname*))
  (setf *connection* (connect :nickname *nickname* :server server))
  (join *connection* channel)
  (add-hook *connection* 'irc::irc-privmsg-message 'msg-hook)
  (start-background-message-handler *connection*))

title: emacs rails view switching
contents:
;;; action/view switching functions

(defun arorem-switch-view ()
  (interactive)
  (cond ((arorem-controller-p (buffer-file-name)) (arorem-controller-to-view))
	((arorem-view-p (buffer-file-name)) (arorem-view-to-controller))))

(defun arorem-controller-p (filename)
  (string-match "app/controllers/" filename))

(defun arorem-view-p (filename)
  (string-match "app/views/" filename))

(defun arorem-model-p (filename)
  (string-match "app/models/" filename))

(defun arorem-unit-p (filename)
  (string-match "test/unit/" filename))

(defun arorem-functional-p (filename)
  (string-match "test/functional" filename))

(defun arorem-controller-to-view ()
  (find-file (arorem-view-name-from-controller (buffer-file-name) 
					       (save-excursion
						 (search-backward "def ")
						 (forward-char 5)
						 (thing-at-point 'filename)))))

(defun arorem-view-name-from-controller (controller action)
  (concat (rails-root)
	  "app/views/"
	  (substring (file-name-nondirectory controller) 0 -14)
	  "/"
	  action
	  ".rhtml"))

(defun arorem-view-to-controller ()
  (setq action (file-name-base (buffer-file-name)))
  (find-file (arorem-controller-name-from-view (buffer-file-name)))
  (beginning-of-buffer)
  (search-forward (concat "def " action))
  (recenter))

(defun arorem-controller-name-from-view (view)
  (concat (rails-root) 
	  "app/controllers/"
	   (file-name-nondirectory 
	    (expand-file-name (concat view "/..")))
	  "_controller.rb"))

title: Exemplo Busca BInária
convert
contents:
(defun convert-to-base-10 (number base)
  (loop 
     :for num = number :then (truncate num 10)
     :for place = 1 :then (* place base)
     :until (zerop num)
     :sum (* (mod num 10) place)))

(defun convert-from-base-10 (number base)
  (loop 
     :for num = number :then (truncate num base)
     :for place = 1 :then (* place 10)
     :until (zerop num)
     :sum (* (mod num base) place)))

(defun convert-from-base-10s (number base)
   (parse-integer (format nil "~VR" base number)))  
(defun convert-to-base-10s (number base)
   (parse-integer (format nil "~D" number) :radix base))

title: mtty
contents:
#!/bin/bash
# Usage: preload-emacs <name> [<waitp>]
#
# Preloads the Emacs instance called NAME in a detached screen
# session.  Does nothing if the instance is already running.  If WAITP
# is non-empty, the function waits until the server starts up and
# creates its socket; otherwise it returns immediately.

name="$1"
waitp="$2"
screendir="/var/run/screen/S-$USER"
serverdir="/tmp/emacs$UID"
emacs=/usr/bin/emacs # Or wherever you installed your multi-tty Emacs

if [ -z "$name" ]; then 
    echo "Usage: preload_emacs <name> [<waitp>]" >&2
    exit 1
fi

if [ ! -e "$screendir"/*."$name" ]; then
    if [ -e "$serverdir/$name" ]; then
        # Delete leftover socket (for the wait option)
        rm "$serverdir/$name"
    fi
    screen -dmS "$name" "$emacs" -nw --eval "(setq server-name \"$name\")" -f server-start
fi
if [ ! -z "$waitp" ]; then
    while [ ! -e "$serverdir/$name" ]; do sleep 0.1; done
fi


#!/bin/bash
# Usage: connect-emacs <name> <args>...
#
# Connects to the Emacs instance called NAME.  Starts up the instance
# if it is not already running.  The rest of the arguments are passed
# to emacsclient.

name="$1"
shift
    
if [ -z "$name" ]; then
    echo "Usage: connect_emacs <name> <args>..." >&2
    exit 1
fi
/tmp/preload-emacs "$name" wait
/usr/bin/emacsclient -s "$name" "$@"

runListTFull m = do
    x <- runListT' m
    case x of
        Nothing -> return []
        Just (v,n) -> do vs <- runListTFull n
                         return (v:vs)

title: assign a mapced list
contents:
(defun package-maint-unload-package (files)
  "Use package-maint-files-rdep to cleanly unload all the features."
  (let ((max-lisp-eval-depth (* 300 max-lisp-eval-depth)))
    (defun recurse-do (files)
      (cond ((null files) nil)
	    (t
	     (let (notloaded)
	       (dolist (file files)
		 (let* ((feat (intern (file-name-sans-extension file)))
			(rdeps (cadr (assoc file package-maint-files-rdep)))
			unloaded)
		   (when (featurep feat)
		     (setq unloaded (recurse-do rdeps))
		     (unload-feature feat t)
		     (push file unloaded))
		   ;; if file was not loaded exlude rdeps of processable files
		   (when (and rdeps (not unloaded))
		     (setq unloaded rdeps))
		   ;; Avoid processing already unloaded files
		   (dolist (file unloaded)
		     (setq files (delete file files))
		     (add-to-list 'notloaded file))))
	     notloaded))))
    (recurse-do files)))

title: password storage question
contents:
Does the following make sense in order to produce simple password encryption for storage?

Let +md5salt+ be any constant string, and +md5iter+ a positive number.

(defun make-nhash (n seq)
  (if (= n 0)
      seq
      (make-nhash (- n 1) 
		  (md5:md5sum-sequence seq))))

(defun make-md5hash (seq)
  (make-nhash +md5iter+ (concatenate 'string +md5salt+ seq)))

title: paren-match
contents:
(defun paren-match ()
  "Jumps to the paren matching the one under point,
and does nothing if there isn't one."
  (interactive)
  (cond
   ((looking-at "[({[]") (forward-sexp 1) (backward-char))
   ((looking-at "[]})]") (forward-char) (backward-sexp 1))
   (t           (message "Could not find matching paren."))) )

(global-set-key "\C-x,"     'paren-match)

title: ctypes usage
contents:
from ctypes import *
libc = cdll.LoadLibrary('libc.so.6')
class timeval(Structure):
    _fields_ = [
        ('tv_sec', c_long),
        ('tv_usec', c_long),
        ]
class timezone(Structure):
    _fields_ = [
        ('tv_minuteswest', c_int),
        ('tv_dsttime', c_int),
        ]
c_gettimeofday = libc.gettimeofday
c_gettimeofday.argtypes = [c_void_p, c_void_p]
c_gettimeofday.restype = c_int
def gettimeofday():
    tv = timeval()
    tz = timezone()
    c_gettimeofday(byref(tv), byref(tz))
    return tv.tv_sec, tv.tv_usec
print gettimeofday()

title: CFFI usage
contents:
(asdf:operate 'asdf:load-op 'cffi)
(defpackage :cffi-user
  (:use :common-lisp :cffi))
(in-package :cffi-user)
(define-foreign-library libc
  (:unix "libc.so.6"))
(use-foreign-library libc)
(defcstruct timeval
  (tv_sec :long)
  (tv_usec :long))
(defcstruct timezone
  (tv_minuteswest :int)
  (tv_dsttime :int))
(defcfun ("gettimeofday" c-gettimeofday) :int
  (tv :pointer)
  (tz :pointer))
(defun gettimeofday ()
  (with-foreign-objects ((tv 'timeval) (tz 'timezone))
    (c-gettimeofday tv tz)
    (with-foreign-slots ((tv_sec tv_usec) tv timeval)
      (list tv_sec tv_usec))))
(write (gettimeofday))

instance Monad GUI
contents:
data Message = Message
data GUI a = GUI {runGUI :: Message -> (a, GUI a)}

instance Functor GUI where
    fmap f g = GUI (\m -> let (val, g') = runGUI g m in (f val, fmap f g'))

instance Monad GUI where
    return x = g
     where
        g = GUI (\m -> (x, g))
    g >>= f = GUI (\m -> let (x, g') = runGUI g m; (y, f') = runGUI (f x) m in (y, g' >> f'))

(defun defstub (pack symb)
    (unless (packagep pack) (setq pack (find-package pack)))
    (let ((sname (symbol-name symb))(pakdsym (in-package sname pack)))
        (unless pakdsym (setq pakdsym symb))
        (if (fboundp pakdsym) 
            (symbol-function pakdsym)
            (let ((macrodefr   
                    (list 'defmacro pakdsym '(&rest args)
                        `(remote-call pack pakdsym ,args))))
                        (eval macrodefr)
                        (eval-remote *cyc-server* macrodefr)
                        (symbol-function pakdsym)))))

title: Break Countdown AppleScript
contents:
-- Break Countdown
-- By Paul Tow (alias Macskeeball)
-- macskeeball@gmail.com
-- Outputs the amount of time remaining in the ten minute break

on title()
	return "Break Countdown"
end title

on keyword()
	-- "%_break" is the keyword that Adium attempts to
	-- detect. If detected it will run the script.
	return "%_break"
end keyword

on substitute()
	if break_start is "" then
		set break_start to (time of (current date)) as integer
		set break_end to break_start + 600
	end if
	
	set break_end_hour to break_end div 3600
	set break_end_minutes to (break_end mod 3600) div 60
	set break_remaining to break_end - (time of (current date)) as integer
	
	if (break_end_hour is less than 12) then
		if (break_end_hour is equal to 0) then set break_end_hour to (break_end_hour + 12)
		return "Be back in about " & (break_remaining div 60) & " min (" & break_end_hour & ":" & break_end_minutes & "AM CST)"
	else
		if (break_end_hour is greater than 12) then set break_end_hour to (break_end_hour - 12)
		return "Be back in about " & (break_remaining div 60) & " min (" & break_end_hour & ":" & break_end_minutes & "PM CST)"
	end if
end substitute

title: OpenMCL's IGNORABLE implementation
contents:
(defnxdecl ignorable (pending decl env)
  (declare (ignore env))
  (dolist (s (%cdr decl))
    (if (symbolp s)
      (nx-new-vdecl pending s 'ignore-if-unused t)
      (if (and (consp s)
               (eq (%car s) 'function)
               (consp (%cdr s))
               (symbolp (setq s (%cadr s))))       ;***
        (nx-new-fdecl pending s 'ignore-if-unused t)
        (nx-bad-decls decl)))))

title: Checksum Approaches
contents:
Context: 

 * http://downlode.org/rdf/file-properties/ (by Earle Martin)
 * http://chatlogs.planetrdf.com/swig/2006-04-25.html#T18-01-57

Current approach: 

  <fp:checksum>
    <fp:Checksum>
      <fp:generator>
        <wn:Algorithm rdf:about="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MD5" />
      </fp:generator>
      <fp:checksumValue>e89760b5510974acbea8ff4c77a1a5c0</fp:checksumValue>
    </fp:Checksum>
  </fp:checksum>

Flat approach, suggested by theorbtwo on #swig: 

   <fp:md5>e89760b5510974acbea8ff4c77a1a5c0</fp:md5>

Datatypes approach: 

   <fp:checksum rdf:datatype="http://example.org/datatypes/md5"
                >e89760b5510974acbea8ff4c77a1a5c0</fp:checksum>

Interpretation properties approach: 

   <fp:checksum rdf:type="Resource">
      <fp:md5>e89760b5510974acbea8ff4c77a1a5c0</fp:md5>
   </fp:checksum>

Note how the flat, datatypes, and interpretation approaches all incur significantly less overhead than the current approach; but as to which of them is preferable, it's difficult to say.

(defun gen-scenarios (limit)
  (if (> limit 0)
      (let (x (random-range 1 3))
        (push (cond (= x 3) (list :a NIL :b NIL :c T)
                    (= x 2) (list :a NIL :b T :c NIL)
                    (= x 1) (list :a T :b NIL :c NIL))
              *scenarios*)
        (gen-scenarios (- limit 1)))
      0))

We're proud to announce that ScummVM support for The Legend of Kyrandia is now complete!

This means that we now need you, our users, to give us a helping hand. In order to root out any remaining bugs, extensive testing is sorely needed. Currently both CD and floppy editions are supported in their own language. English, French, German and Spanish versions are fully supported, but any other PC (and hopefully Mac) version should work as well (albeit with some text in English, and some interface graphics missing). If you have an unsupported version, we'd love to hear from you! Note that Amiga versions are unfortunately not supported at all at this time.

title: getting MonadPlus to work
contents:
{- I am trying to make Sheep an instance of MonadPlus. 
   what imports do I need for this to work?
-}


{- Author:     Jeff Newbern
   Maintainer: Jeff Newbern <jnewbern@nomaware.com>
   Time-stamp: <Mon Nov 10 11:58:21 2003>
   License:    GPL
-}

{- DESCRIPTION

Example 2 - Do notation

Usage: Compile the code and execute the resulting program.
       It will print Dolly's maternal grandfather.
-}

-- everything you need to know about sheep
data Sheep = Sheep {name::String, mother::Maybe Sheep, father::Maybe Sheep}

-- we show sheep by name
instance Show Sheep where
  show s = show (name s)

-- the Maybe type is already declared as an instance of the Monad class
-- in the standard prelude, so we don't actually need to define it here.
-- just remember that it looks something like this:
-- instance Monad Maybe where
--    Nothing  >>= f = Nothing
--    (Just x) >>= f = f x
--    return         = Just


instance MonadPlus Sheep where
    mzero             = Nothing

-- we can use do-notation to build complicated sequences
maternalGrandfather :: Sheep -> Maybe Sheep
{-
maternalGrandfather s = do m <- mother s
			   father m
-}
-- maternalGrandfather s = (return s) >>= mother >>= father 
maternalGrandfather s = mother s >>= father 

fathersMaternalGrandmother :: Sheep -> Maybe Sheep
fathersMaternalGrandmother s = do f  <- father s
                                  gm <- mother f
				  mother gm

mothersPaternalGrandfather :: Sheep -> Maybe Sheep
mothersPaternalGrandfather s = do m  <- mother s
                                  gf <- father m
				  father gf

parent :: Sheep -> Maybe Sheep
parent = mother `mplus` father

-- this builds our sheep family tree
breedSheep :: Sheep
breedSheep = let adam   = Sheep "Adam" Nothing Nothing
                 eve    = Sheep "Eve" Nothing Nothing
		 uranus = Sheep "Uranus" Nothing Nothing
		 gaea   = Sheep "Gaea" Nothing Nothing
		 kronos = Sheep "Kronos" (Just gaea) (Just uranus)
                 holly  = Sheep "Holly" (Just eve) (Just adam)
		 roger  = Sheep "Roger" (Just eve) (Just kronos)
		 molly  = Sheep "Molly" (Just holly) (Just roger)
			  in Sheep "Dolly" (Just molly) Nothing

-- print Dolly's maternal grandfather
main :: IO ()
main = let dolly = breedSheep
       in do print (maternalGrandfather dolly)

-- END OF FILE

;; XML/SGML - PSGML
;;
;;   First, we'll just set up PSGML. Then we'll create a derived mode for
;;   (X)HTML using mmm-mode for fancy (X)HTML/CSS/Javascript/PHP coding

(autoload 'sgml-mode "psgml" "Major mode to edit SGML files." t )
(autoload 'xml-mode "psgml" "Major mode to edit XML files." t)

(setq auto-mode-alist
  (append
  (list
    '("\\.sgm$" 	. 	sgml-mode)
    '("\\.sgml$" 	. 	sgml-mode)
    '("\\.xml$" 	. 	xml-mode)
	'("\\.rss$"		. 	xml-mode)
	'("\\.svg$"		.	xml-mode)
	'("\\.xslt"		. 	xml-mode)
	'("\\.xsd"		.	xml-mode)
    )
  auto-mode-alist))

;; create faces to assign to markup categories

(make-face 'sgml-comment-face)
(make-face 'sgml-start-tag-face)
(make-face 'sgml-end-tag-face)
(make-face 'sgml-entity-face)
(make-face 'sgml-doctype-face) ; DOCTYPE data
(make-face 'sgml-ignored-face) ; data ignored by PSGML
(make-face 'sgml-ms-start-face) ; marked sections start
(make-face 'sgml-ms-end-face) ; end of marked section
(make-face 'sgml-pi-face) ; processing instructions
(make-face 'sgml-sgml-face) ; the SGML declaration
(make-face 'sgml-shortref-face) ; short references

;; assign faces to markup categories

(setq sgml-markup-faces '
  (
  (comment . sgml-comment-face)
  (start-tag . sgml-start-tag-face)
  (end-tag . sgml-end-tag-face)
  (entity . sgml-entity-face)
  (doctype . sgml-doctype-face)
  (ignored . sgml-ignored-face)
  (ms-start . sgml-ms-start-face)
  (ms-end . sgml-ms-end-face)
  (pi . sgml-pi-face)
  (sgml . sgml-sgml-face)
  (shortref . sgml-shortref-face)
  ))

;; tell PSGML to pay attention to face settings

(setq sgml-set-face t)

;; Set up "DTD->Insert DTD" menu.

(setq sgml-custom-dtd
  '(
    ( "HTML 4.01 Strict"
      "<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN\"\n \"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/strict.dtd\">"
      sgml-declaration "~/lib/DTD/html401/HTML4.decl"
      sgml-default-dtd-file "~/lib/DTD/html401/strict.ced"
      mode sgml-html )
    ( "HTML 4.01 Transitional"
      "<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN\"\n \"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd\">"
      sgml-declaration "~/lib/DTD/html401/HTML4.decl"
      sgml-default-dtd-file "~/lib/DTD/html401/loose.ced" 
      mode sgml-html )
    ( "HTML 4.01 Frameset"
      "<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Frameset//EN\"\n \"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/frameset.dtd\">"
      sgml-declaration "~/lib/DTD/html401/HTML4.decl"
      sgml-default-dtd-file "~/lib/DTD/html401/frameset.ced" 
      mode sgml-html )
    ( "XHTML 1.0 Strict"
      "<?xml version=\"1.0\"?>\n<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN\"\n \"http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd\">"
      sgml-default-dtd-file "~/lib/DTD/xhtml1/xhtml1-strict.ced" 
      mode xml-html )
    ( "XHTML 1.0 Transitional"
      "<?xml version=\"1.0\"?>\n<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN\"\n \"http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd\">"
      sgml-default-dtd-file "~/lib/DTD/xhtml1/xhtml1-transitional.ced" 
      mode xml-html )
    ( "XHTML 1.0 Frameset"
      "<?xml version=\"1.0\"?>\n<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Frameset//EN\"\n \"http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-frameset.dtd\">"
      sgml-default-dtd-file "~/lib/DTD/xhtml1/xhtml1-frameset.ced" 
      mode xml-html )
    ( "XHTML 1.1"
      "<?xml version=\"1.0\"?>\n<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.1//EN\"\n \"http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml11/DTD/xhtml11.dtd\">"
      sgml-default-dtd-file "~/lib/DTD/xhtml11/xhtml11.ced" 
      mode xml-html )

;; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
;; (X)HTML - PSGML with MMM Mode for CSS, Javascript and PHP support
;;
;;	http://www.dzr-web.com/people/darren/projects/emacs-webdev/

(define-derived-mode xml-html-mode xml-mode "XHTML"
  "This version of html mode is just a wrapper around xml mode."
  (make-local-variable 'sgml-declaration)
  (make-local-variable 'sgml-default-doctype-name)
  (setq
   sgml-default-doctype-name    "html"
   sgml-declaration             "/usr/share/sgml/declaration/xml.dcl"
   sgml-always-quote-attributes t
   sgml-indent-step             2
   sgml-indent-data             t
   sgml-minimize-attributes     nil
   sgml-omittag                 nil
   sgml-shorttag                nil
   )
  )

(define-derived-mode sgml-html-mode sgml-mode "HTML"
  "This version of html mode is just a wrapper around sgml mode."
  (make-local-variable 'sgml-declaration)
  (make-local-variable 'sgml-default-doctype-name)
  (setq
   sgml-default-doctype-name    "html"
   sgml-declaration             "~/lib/DTD/html401/HTML4.decl"
   sgml-always-quote-attributes t
   sgml-indent-step             2
   sgml-indent-data             t
   sgml-minimize-attributes     nil
   sgml-omittag                 nil
   sgml-shorttag                nil
   )
  )

(require 'generic-x)

;; MMM-Mode
(require 'mmm-auto)
(setq mmm-global-mode 'maybe)

;; Set up an mmm group for fancy html editing
(mmm-add-group
 'fancy-html
 '(
         (html-php-embedded
                :submode php-mode
                :face mmm-output-submode-face
                :front "<[?]php"
                :back "[?]>")
         (html-css-embedded
                :submode css-mode
                :face mmm-declaration-submode-face
                :front "<style\[^>\]*>"
                :back "</style>")
         (html-css-attribute
                :submode css-mode
                :face mmm-declaration-submode-face
                :front "\\bstyle=\\s-*\""
                :back "\"")
         (html-javascript-embedded
                :submode javascript-generic-mode
                :face mmm-code-submode-face
                :front "<script\[^>\]*>"
                :back "</script>")
         (html-javascript-attribute
                :submode javascript-generic-mode
                :face mmm-code-submode-face
                :front "\\bon\\w+=\\s-*\""
                :back "\"")
   )
)

;; What files to invoke the new html-mode for?
;;   HTML and XHTML tend to have the same file extensions. However, XHTML
;;   hopefully has either one or both of <?xml or W3C//DTD XHTML near the
;;   beginning. So we default to sgml-html-mode and then add a hook to
;;   sgml-html-mode to check for either of those strings and switch to
;;   xml-html-mode if it finds them.

;;(add-to-list 'auto-mode-alist '("\\.inc\\'" . sgml-html-mode))
;;(add-to-list 'auto-mode-alist '("\\.php[34]?\\'" . sgml-html-mode))
;;(add-to-list 'auto-mode-alist '("\\.[sj]?html?$\\'" . sgml-html-mode))

(add-hook 'sgml-html-mode-hook 'guess-xhtml-hook t)

(defun guess-xhtml-hook ()
  "Guess whether the current buffer is XHTML."
  (when 
    (save-excursion 
      (search-forward-regexp "<[?]xml\\|//W3C//DTD XHTML" 80 t))
    (xml-html-mode)
    ))

;; Make smgl-html-mode and xml-html-mode use fancy-html
(add-to-list 'mmm-mode-ext-classes-alist '(sgml-html-mode nil fancy-html))
(add-to-list 'mmm-mode-ext-classes-alist '(xml-html-mode nil fancy-html))

(require 'w3m)
(eval-after-load "w3m"

     (defun w3m-safe-view-this-url ()
       (interactive)
       (if (not (setq url (w3m-url-valid (w3m-anchor))))

       (if url
         (browse-url url)
       (message "No URL at point")))))

(defun my-gcd
(a_0 b_0)
(prog
(v0 v1 (b_0 b_0) v2 b_1 b_2 v3 r_0 (a_0 a_0) v4)
tag0
(setf v4 (mod a_0 b_0))
(setf b_1 b_0 r_0 v4)
(go tag1)
tag1
(setf v1 (not (zerop r_0)))
(if v1
(progn
(setf b_2 r_0 v2 b_1)
(go tag3)
) ; else
(progn
(setf v3 b_1)
(go tag2)
))
tag2
(return v3)
tag3
(setf v0 (mod v2 b_2))
(setf b_1 b_2 r_0 v0)
(go tag1)
))
(write ( my-gcd 96 64 ))

title: what is #{Unspecific} ?

(define-syntax emit
  (syntax-rules ()
    ((_ body ...)
     `(body ...))))

(define-syntax emit-for
  (syntax-rules (= to do)
    ((_ x = m to n do body ...)
     (letrec ((loop (lambda (x)
                      (if (<= x n)
                          (emit body ...
                                ,@(loop (+ x 1)))))))
       (loop m)))))


====

(scratch)> (emit ,@(emit-for i = 1 to m do
			     (,$store ,i (+ ,E.stk 1))))

(define (generate-call-expression E env stkenv regenv reg stk tail)
  (let* ((regenv QEnv.empty)
         (reg    0)
         (stk    (+ stk reg 1))
         (tail   false)
         (E0     (generate-expression (astCallExp.proc E)
                                      env stkenv regenv reg stk tail))
         (Es     (astCallExp.proc E))
         (m      (length Es))
         (reg    (+ m 1)
         (Es     (generate-expressions Es
                                       env stkenv regenv reg stk tail))))
    
    ))

title: Something ``practical'' in Lisp
contents:
(define (sexp->html html)
  (cond ((pair? html)
         (string-append
          (apply string-append
                 "<" (symbol->string (car html)) ">"
                 (map sexp->html (cdr html)))
          "</" (symbol->string (car html)) ">"))
        ((symbol? html)
         (string-append (symbol->string html) " "))
        (else html)))

(define (get a)
  (sexp->html '(html
                (head (title "Rocking the Web"))
                (body
                 (h1 "Generating HTML page with Scheme")
                 (p "Hello" (em "cruel world."))))))

title: buginess
returning a single instance
my latest try
contents:
(defun esa-command-parser (command-table stream)
  (let ((command-name nil)
        (command-args nil))
    (with-delimiter-gestures (*command-name-delimiters* :override t)
      ;; While reading the command name we want use the history of the
      ;; (accept 'command ...) that's calling this function.
      (setq command-name (accept `(command-name :command-table ,command-table)
                                 :stream (encapsulating-stream-stream stream)
                                 :prompt "Extended Command: "
                                 :prompt-mode :raw :history nil))
      (let ((delimiter (read-gesture :stream stream :peek-p t)))
        ;; Let argument parsing function see activation gestures.
        (when (and delimiter (delimiter-gesture-p delimiter))
          (read-gesture :stream stream))))
    (with-delimiter-gestures (*command-argument-delimiters* :override t)
      (let* ((info (gethash command-name climi::*command-parser-table*))
             (required-args (climi::required-args info))
             (keyword-args (climi::keyword-args info)))
        (let (result)
          ;; only required args for now.
          (dolist (arg required-args (cons command-name (nreverse result)))
            (destructuring-bind (name ptype &rest args) arg
              (declare (ignore name))
              ;; This is fucking nuts.  FIXME: the clim spec says
              ;; ":GESTURE is not evaluated at all".  Um, but how are
              ;; you meant to tell if a keyword argument is :GESTURE,
              ;; then?  The following does not actually allow variable
              ;; keys: anyone who writes (define-command foo ((bar
              ;; 'pathname *random-arg* ""))) and expects it to work
              ;; deserves to lose.
              (push (apply #'accept
                           (eval ptype) 
                           :stream (encapsulating-stream-stream stream)
                           (loop for (key val) on args by #'cddr
                                 unless (eq key :gesture)
                                 collect key and collect (eval val)))
                    result))))))))

;; plus (*command-parser* 'esa-command-parser) in ESA-TOP-LEVEL

title: comparing
contents:
(defun find-greatest(tehlist)
	(let ((thea (nth 0 (list 'tehlist)))))
	(let ((theb (nth 1 (list 'tehlist)))))
	(let ((thec (nth 2 (list 'tehlist)))))
	(let ((thed (nth 3 (list 'tehlist)))))
	(print 'thea)
	(let ((highest '"realist")))
	(if (> 'theb 'thea)(setf highest '"legalist"))
	(if (> 'thec 'theb)(setf highest '"analyst"))
	(if (> 'thed 'thec)(setf highest '"empathist"))
	(print highest)
	)
