title: regexp no case
contents:
(defun pjb-regexp-nocase-region (start end)
  (interactive "r")
  (let* ( (s (string-to-vector (buffer-substring start end)))
         (l (length s))
          (r nil) 
          (i 0) 
          c C )
    (while (< i l) 
      (setq c (aref s i))
      (setq C (upcase   c))
      (setq c (downcase c))
      (if (eq c C)
          (setq r (cons (format "%c" c) r))
          (setq r (cons (format "[%c%c]" C c) r)))
      (setq i (1+ i))
      ) ;;while
    (delete-region start end)
    (insert (apply 'concat (nreverse r)))))

title: X
contents:
(defpackage "MECHANUS-LISP"
  (:use "COMMON-LISP"))

(defpackage "MECHANUS-LISP-USER"
  (:use "MECHANUS-LISP"))

(in-package "MECHANUS-LISP")

(shadow '(set get tag type rep eval special = cond))

(setf *print-circle* t)

(defun get (name env)
  (dolist (frame env (error "GET: Unbound name: ~S" name))
    (let ((bind (assoc name frame)))
      (if bind (return-from get (cdr bind))))))

(defun set (name value env)
  (dolist (frame env (error "SET: Unbound name: ~S" name))
    (let ((bind (assoc name frame)))
      (if bind (return (progn (setf (cdr bind) value) value))))))

(defun bind (name value env)
  (push (cons name value) (car env))
  value)

(defun getcall (name env &rest arguments)
  (apply (get name env) arguments))

(defmacro with-env ((name &optional env) &body forms)
  (let ((env-var (gensym))
	(tl-var (gensym)))
    `(let* ((,env-var ,env)
	    (,tl-var (get '*toplevel* ,env-var))
	    (,name (cons nil ,env-var)))
       (bind '*toplevel* ,tl-var ,name)
       (bind '*env* ,name ,name)
       ,@forms)))

(defstruct special
  fn)

(defun eval (form env)
  (typecase form
    (null
     form)
    (symbol
     (get form env))
    (cons
     (let ((op (getcall 'eval env (car form) env))
	   (args (cdr form)))
       (typecase op
	 (function (apply op (mapcar #'(lambda (form) (getcall 'eval env form env)) args)))
	 (special (apply (special-fn op) (list* env args)))
	 (t (error "~S is inapplicable" op)))))
    (t form)))

(defun special (fn)
  (make-special :fn fn))

(defun proper-list-p (list)
  (not (cdr (last list))))

(defun fn (env params &rest forms)
  #'(lambda (&rest args)
      (with-env (env2 env)
        (if (and (proper-list-p params)
		 (/= (length args) (length params)))
	    (error "Argument length mismatch"))
	(loop :for param :on params
	      :for arg :on args
	      :do (progn
		    (bind (car param) (car arg) env2)
		    (unless (listp (cdr param))
		      (bind (cdr param) (cdr arg) env2))))
	(let ((result nil)
	      (env env2))
	  (dolist (form forms)
	    (setf result (multiple-value-list (getcall 'eval env form env))))
	  (values-list result)))))

(defun = (env place value)
  (let ((value (getcall 'eval env value env)))
    (if (cdr env)
	(set place value env)
      (bind place value env))))

(defun cond (env &rest clauses)
  (if (cdr clauses)
      (if (getcall 'eval env (car clauses) env)
	  (getcall 'eval env (cadr clauses) env)
	(apply #'cond env (cddr clauses)))
    (getcall 'eval env (car clauses) env)))

(defun pr (&rest objects)
  (dolist (object objects)
    (princ object))
  (terpri)
  (car (last objects)))

(defstruct tag
  type rep)

(defun tag (type rep)
  (if (eq (type rep) type)
      rep
    (make-tag :type type :rep rep)))

(defun type (tag)
  (typecase tag
    (tag (tag-type tag))
    (t (class-name (class-of tag)))))

(defun rep (tag)
  (typecase tag
    (tag (tag-rep tag))
    (t tag)))

(defvar *toplevel*
  `(((get . ,#'get)
     (set . ,#'set)
     (bind . ,#'bind)
     (apply . ,#'apply)
     (quote . ,(special #'(lambda (env x) x)))
     (pr . ,#'pr)
     (eval . ,#'eval)
     (cond . ,(special #'cond))
     (+ . ,#'+)
     (fn . ,(special #'fn))
     (= . ,(special #'=))
     (is . ,#'eq)
     (tag . ,#'tag)
     (type . ,#'type)
     (rep . ,#'rep)
     (cons . ,#'cons)
     (car . ,#'car)
     (cdr . ,#'cdr)
     (apply . ,#'apply)
     (special . ,#'special)
     (do . ,(special #'(lambda (env &rest forms)
			 (let ((result nil))
			   (dolist (form forms)
			     (setf result (multiple-value-list (getcall 'eval env form env))))
			   (values-list result)
			   )))))))

(bind '*toplevel* *toplevel* *toplevel*)

(bind '*env* *toplevel* *toplevel*)

(set-dispatch-macro-character #\# #\{
  #'(lambda (stream character argument)
      (declare (ignore character argument))
      (let ((forms (read-delimited-list #\} stream t)))
	`(progn
	   ,@(loop :for form :in forms
		   ;:collect `(getcall 'pr *toplevel* (getcall 'eval *toplevel* ',form *toplevel*)))))))
		   :collect `(getcall 'eval *toplevel* ',form *toplevel*))))))

	(apply #'cond env (cddr clauses)))
    (getcall 'eval env (car clauses) env)))

(defun pr (&rest objects)
  (dolist (object objects)
    (princ object))
  (terpri)
  (car (last objects)))

(defstruct tag
  type rep)

(defun tag (type rep)
  (if (eq (type rep) type)
      rep
    (make-tag :type type :rep rep)))

(defun type (tag)
  (typecase tag
    (tag (tag-type tag))
    (t (class-name (class-of tag)))))

(defun rep (tag)
  (typecase tag
    (tag (tag-rep tag))
    (t tag)))

(defvar *toplevel*
  `(((get . ,#'get)
     (set . ,#'set)
     (bind . ,#'bind)
     (apply . ,#'apply)
     (quote . ,(special #'(lambda (env x) x)))
     (pr . ,#'pr)
     (eval . ,#'eval)
     (cond . ,(special #'cond))
     (+ . ,#'+)
     (fn . ,(special #'fn))
     (= . ,(special #'=))
     (is . ,#'eq)
     (tag . ,#'tag)
     (type . ,#'type)
     (rep . ,#'rep)
     (cons . ,#'cons)
     (car . ,#'car)
     (cdr . ,#'cdr)
     (apply . ,#'apply)
     (special . ,#'special)
     (macro . ,#'macro)
     (do . ,(special #'(lambda (env &rest forms)
			 (let ((result nil))
			   (dolist (form forms)
			     (setf result (multiple-value-list (getcall 'eval env form env))))
			   (values-list result)
			   )))))))

(bind '*toplevel* *toplevel* *toplevel*)

(bind '*env* *toplevel* *toplevel*)

(set-dispatch-macro-character #\# #\{
  #'(lambda (stream character argument)
      (declare (ignore character argument))
      (let ((forms (read-delimited-list #\} stream t)))
	`(progn
	   ,@(loop :for form :in forms
		   ;:collect `(getcall 'pr *toplevel* (getcall 'eval *toplevel* ',form *toplevel*)))))))
		   :collect `(getcall 'eval *toplevel* ',form *toplevel*))))))

title: X
contents:
(defpackage "MECHANUS-LISP"
  (:use "COMMON-LISP"))

(defpackage "MECHANUS-LISP-USER"
  (:use "MECHANUS-LISP"))

(in-package "MECHANUS-LISP")

(shadow '(set get tag type rep eval special = cond))

(setf *print-circle* t)

(defun get (name env)
  (dolist (frame env (error "GET: Unbound name: ~S" name))
    (let ((bind (assoc name frame)))
      (if bind (return-from get (cdr bind))))))

(defun set (name value env)
  (dolist (frame env (error "SET: Unbound name: ~S" name))
    (let ((bind (assoc name frame)))
      (if bind (return (progn (setf (cdr bind) value) value))))))

(defun bind (name value env)
  (push (cons name value) (car env))
  value)

(defun getcall (name env &rest arguments)
  (apply (get name env) arguments))

(defmacro with-env ((name &optional env) &body forms)
  (let ((env-var (gensym))
	(tl-var (gensym)))
    `(let* ((,env-var ,env)
	    (,tl-var (get '*toplevel* ,env-var))
	    (,name (cons nil ,env-var)))
       (bind '*toplevel* ,tl-var ,name)
       (bind '*env* ,name ,name)
       ,@forms)))

(defstruct special
  fn)

(defstruct macro
  fn)

(defun eval (form env)
  (typecase form
    (null
     form)
    (symbol
     (get form env))
    (cons
     (let ((op (getcall 'eval env (car form) env))
	   (args (cdr form)))
       (typecase op
	 (function (apply op (mapcar #'(lambda (form) (getcall 'eval env form env)) args)))
	 (special (apply (special-fn op) (list* env args)))
	 (macro (apply (macro-fn op) (list* env args)))
	 (t (error "~S is inapplicable" op)))))
    (t form)))

(defun special (fn)
  (make-special :fn fn))

(defun macro (fn)
  (make-macro :fn fn))

(defun proper-list-p (list)
  (not (cdr (last list))))

(defun fn (env params &rest forms)
  #'(lambda (&rest args)
      (with-env (env2 env)
        (if (and (proper-list-p params)
		 (/= (length args) (length params)))
	    (error "Argument length mismatch"))
	(loop :for param :on params
	      :for arg :on args
	      :do (progn
		    (bind (car param) (car arg) env2)
		    (unless (listp (cdr param))
		      (bind (cdr param) (cdr arg) env2))))
	(let ((result nil)
	      (env env2))
	  (dolist (form forms)
	    (setf result (multiple-value-list (getcall 'eval env form env))))
	  (values-list result)))))

(defun = (env place value)
  (let ((value (getcall 'eval env value env)))
    (if (cdr env)
	(set place value env)
      (bind place value env))))

(defun cond (env &rest clauses)
  (if (cdr clauses)
      (if (getcall 'eval env (car clauses) env)
	  (getcall 'eval env (cadr clauses) env)
	(apply #'cond env (cddr clauses)))
    (getcall 'eval env (car clauses) env)))

(defun pr (&rest objects)
  (dolist (object objects)
    (princ object))
  (terpri)
  (car (last objects)))

(defstruct tag
  type rep)

(defun tag (type rep)
  (if (eq (type rep) type)
      rep
    (make-tag :type type :rep rep)))

(defun type (tag)
  (typecase tag
    (tag (tag-type tag))
    (t (class-name (class-of tag)))))

(defun rep (tag)
  (typecase tag
    (tag (tag-rep tag))
    (t tag)))

(defvar *toplevel*
  `(((get . ,#'get)
     (set . ,#'set)
     (bind . ,#'bind)
     (apply . ,#'apply)
     (quote . ,(special #'(lambda (env x) x)))
     (pr . ,#'pr)
     (eval . ,#'eval)
     (cond . ,(special #'cond))
     (+ . ,#'+)
     (fn . ,(special #'fn))
     (= . ,(special #'=))
     (is . ,#'eq)
     (tag . ,#'tag)
     (type . ,#'type)
     (rep . ,#'rep)
     (cons . ,#'cons)
     (car . ,#'car)
     (cdr . ,#'cdr)
     (apply . ,#'apply)
     (special . ,#'special)
     (macro . ,#'macro)
     (do . ,(special #'(lambda (env &rest forms)
			 (let ((result nil))
			   (dolist (form forms)
			     (setf result (multiple-value-list (getcall 'eval env form env))))
			   (values-list result)
			   )))))))

(bind '*toplevel* *toplevel* *toplevel*)

(bind '*env* *toplevel* *toplevel*)

(set-dispatch-macro-character #\# #\{
  #'(lambda (stream character argument)
      (declare (ignore character argument))
      (let ((forms (read-delimited-list #\} stream t)))
	`(progn
	   ,@(loop :for form :in forms
		   ;:collect `(getcall 'pr *toplevel* (getcall 'eval *toplevel* ',form *toplevel*)))))))
		   :collect `(getcall 'eval *toplevel* ',form *toplevel*))))))

title: LET-KEYS: TNG
contents:
(define employee-alist '((fname . "Yosemite")
                         (lname . "Sam")))

(define employee-table
  (let ((t (make-symbol-table)))
    (table-set! t 'fname "Foghorn")
    (table-set! t 'lname "Leghorn")
    (table-set! t 'email "foghorn@leghorn.com")
    t))

(define (employee-fullname employee)
  (let-keys employee
            (fname lname (email "<none>"))
            (list fname lname email)))

(employee-fullname employee-alist)
  ; ==> ("Yosemite" "Sam" "<none>")
(employee-fullname employee-table)
  ; ==> ("Foghorn" "Leghorn" "foghorn@leghorn.com")

(define alist-accessor
  (lambda (c k)
    (let ((pair (assq k c)))
      (if pair (cdr pair) #f))))

(define-syntax let-keys
  (syntax-rules ()
    ((let-keys c (k ...) e1 e2 ...)
     (if (table? c)
         (let-keys-primitive c
                             table-ref
                             (k ...)
                             e1 e2 ...)
         (let-keys-primitive c
                             alist-accessor
                             (k ...)
                             e1 e2 ...)))))

(define-syntax let-keys-primitive
  (syntax-rules ()
    ((let-keys-primitive c accessor () e1 e2 ...)
     (begin e1 e2 ...))
    ((let-keys-primitive c accessor ((k1 d1) k2 ...) e1 e2 ...)
     (let ((k1 (or (accessor c 'k1) d1)))
       (let-keys-primitive c accessor (k2 ...) e1 e2 ...)))
    ((let-keys-primitive c accessor (k1 k2 ...) e1 e2 ...)
     (let ((k1 (or (accessor c 'k1)
                   (error (string-append "key "
                                         (symbol->string 'k1)
                                         " not found")))))
       (let-keys-primitive c accessor (k2 ...) e1 e2 ...)))))

title: What'd I do wrong?
contents:
If I do this operation with the code below, I get this error.
10 <*> (vector 10 [0..9]) 

    No instance for (MatrixProduct a (Vec b) c)
      arising from use of `<*>' at <interactive>:1:3-5
    Probable fix: add an instance declaration for (MatrixProduct a (Vec b) c)
    In the definition of `it': it = 10 <*> (vector 10 ([0 .. 9]))

This seems fairly straight forward, just like in the fundeps wiki page.

import Array
-- The elements and the size
data Vec a = Vec (Array Int a) Int
	   deriving (Show,Eq)
type Matrix a = (Vec (Vec a))
class MatrixProduct a b c | a b -> c where
    (<*>) :: a -> b -> c
instance (Num a) => MatrixProduct a (Vec a) (Vec a) where
    (<*>) num (Vec a s) = Vec (fmap (*num) a) s
vector n elms = Vec (array (0,n-1) $ zip [0..n-1] elms) n

tell application "Terminal"

	if not winCount = 0 then

				tell process "Terminal"
					tell menu bar 1
						tell menu bar item "File"
							tell menu "File"
								click menu item "New Shell"

		on error
			return false
		end try
	end if
end tell

title: patch for ggaren
breakout
contents:
;; Alexander Annese and Kyle Obernautervaunhenfunkr
;; FINAL PROJECT
;; BREAKOUT

(define-struct vec (x y))
;; A Vec is a (make-vec Num Num)

(define-struct ball (pos vel))
;; A Ball is a (make-ball Posn Vec)

(define-struct brick (pos))
;; A Brick is a (make-brick Posn)

(define-struct paddle (pos))
;; A Paddle is a (make-paddle Posn)

;; A KeyEvent is one of:
;; -- Char (char?)
;; -- Symbol (symbol?)

(define-struct world (ball brick paddle))
;; A World is (make-world (Ball [Listof Brick] Paddle)

(define WIDTH 800)
(define HEIGHT 600)
(define GRAIN 0.01)
(define BALL-RAD 5)
(define BALL-IMG (circle BALL-RAD 'solid 'red))
(define INIT-BALL false)
(define PADDLE (overlay (rectangle 100 10 'solid 'black)
                        (rectangle 100 10 'outline 'green)))
(define BRICK (overlay (rectangle 50 20 'solid 'blue)
                       (rectangle 50 20 'outline 'black)))

;; scenerender : [Listof Brick] Scene -> Scene
(define (scenerender x s)
  (cond
    [(empty? x) s]
    [else
     (brickrender (first x) (scenerender (rest x) s))]))

;; listrender : [Listof [Listof Bricks]] -> [Listof Bricks]
(define (listrender x)
  (cond
    [(empty? x) x]
    [else
     (append (first x)
             (listrender (rest x)))]))

;; brickrender : Brick Scene -> Scene
(define (brickrender x s)
  (place-image BRICK
               (posn-x (brick-pos x))
               (posn-y (brick-pos x))
               s))   

;; build-row : Num Num -> [Listof Brick]
(define (build-row y n)
  (build-list n
              (lambda (x)
                (make-brick (make-posn (+ 45 (* 55 x))
                                       (+ 20 (* 30 y)))))))

;; build-rows : Num Num -> [Listof [Listof Bricks]]
(define (build-rows x n)
  (build-list n
              (lambda (y)
                (build-row y x))))

(define BREAKOUT (make-world (make-ball (make-posn 300 300)
                                        (make-vec 2 5))
                             (listrender (build-rows 14 5))
                             (make-paddle (make-posn 400 580))))

;; draw-world : World -> Scene
;; draws the world
(define (draw-world world)
  (local ((define ballpos (ball-pos (world-ball world)))
          (define paddlepos (paddle-pos (world-paddle world))))
    (overlay
     (scenerender (world-brick world) (empty-scene WIDTH HEIGHT))
     (place-image PADDLE
                  (posn-x paddlepos)
                  (posn-y paddlepos)
                  (empty-scene WIDTH HEIGHT))
     (place-image BALL-IMG
                  (posn-x ballpos)
                  (posn-y ballpos)
                  (empty-scene WIDTH HEIGHT)))))

;; tock : World -> World
;; applies effects of a clock tick to ball.
;; In ball world, this means if moving collides with a wall,
;; then don't move, just invert velocity.  Otherwise move.
(define (tock world)
  (local ((define new-ball (move-ball (world-ball world)))
          (define new-bricks (world-brick world))
          (define new-paddle (world-paddle world))
          (define new-world (make-world new-ball new-bricks new-paddle))
          (define new-pos (ball-pos new-ball))
          (define cur-pos (ball-pos (world-ball world)))
          (define vel (ball-vel (world-ball world)))
          (define px (posn-x new-pos))
          (define py (posn-y new-pos)))
    (cond
      [(ball-hit-paddle? world)
       (make-world (make-ball cur-pos (make-vec (vec-x vel) 
                                                (- (vec-y vel))))
                   new-bricks
                   new-paddle)]
      [(or (< px (+ 0 BALL-RAD))
           (> px (- WIDTH BALL-RAD)))
       (make-world (make-ball cur-pos (make-vec (- (vec-x vel))
                                                (vec-y vel)))
                   new-bricks
                   new-paddle)]
      [(< py (+ 0 BALL-RAD))           
       (make-world (make-ball cur-pos (make-vec (vec-x vel)
                                                (- (vec-y vel))))
                   new-bricks
                   new-paddle)]
      [(> py (- HEIGHT BALL-RAD))
       BREAKOUT]
      [else
       new-world])))

;; arcreflect : Vec Paddle Ball Ball -> Vec
;(define (arcreflect vel paddle oldball newball)
;  (cond
;    [(< (posn-x (ball-pos newball))
;        (+ -50 (posn-x (paddle-pos paddle))))
;     (cond
;       [(< (posn-x oldball)
;           (posn-x newball))
;        (make-vec (* -1 (posn-x (ball-pos newball)))
;                  (* -1 (posn-x (ball-pos newball))))]
;       [else
;        (make-vec (* 1 (posn-x (ball-pos newball))))])]
;    [else
;     (cond
;       [(< (posn-x (ball-pos oldball))
;           (posn-x (ball-pos newball)))
;        (make-vec (* 1 (posn-x (ball-pos newball)))
;                  5)]
;       [else
;        (make-vec (* -1 (posn-x (ball-pos paddle)))
;                  5)])]))

;; move-ball : Ball -> Ball
;; moves the ball, assuming it moves according to its velocity
(define (move-ball b)
  (local ((define vel (ball-vel b))
          (define pos (ball-pos b))
          (define new-pos (make-posn (+ (vec-x vel) (posn-x pos))
                                     (+ (vec-y vel) (posn-y pos)))))
    (make-ball new-pos vel)))

;;ball-hit-paddle? : WORLD -> boolean
;;tests if ball hits paddle
(define (ball-hit-paddle? w)
  (cond
    [(and
      (>= (posn-x (ball-pos (move-ball (world-ball w))))
          (+ -50 (posn-x (paddle-pos (world-paddle w)))))
      
      (<= (posn-x (ball-pos (move-ball (world-ball w))))
          (+ 50 (posn-x (paddle-pos (world-paddle w)))))
      
      (>= (posn-y (ball-pos (move-ball (world-ball w))))
          (+ -5 (posn-y (paddle-pos (world-paddle w)))))
      
      (<= (posn-y (ball-pos (move-ball (world-ball w))))
          (posn-y (paddle-pos (world-paddle w))))) true]
    [else false]))

;; move-paddle : World KeyEvent -> World
;; produces the next world based on w and ke
(define (move-paddle w ke)
  (cond ;; Two variants
    [(symbol? ke)
     (cond ;; 2 cases
       ;; move left
       [(symbol=? 'left ke) (make-world (world-ball w)
                                        (world-brick w)
                                        (make-paddle
                                         (make-posn       
                                          (- (posn-x (paddle-pos (world-paddle w)))
                                             10)
                                          (posn-y (paddle-pos (world-paddle w))))))]
       ;; move right
       [(symbol=? 'right ke) (make-world (world-ball w)
                                         (world-brick w)
                                         (make-paddle
                                          (make-posn       
                                           (+ (posn-x (paddle-pos (world-paddle w)))
                                              10)
                                           (posn-y (paddle-pos (world-paddle w))))))]
       
       [else w])]
    [else w]))
;       (cond
;        [(char=? #\space ke)
;         (cond
;           [(= 0 (vec-x (ball-vel (world-ball w))))
;            (make-world (make-ball (make-posn 400 570)
;                                   (make-vec 2 5))
;                        (listrender (build-rows 14 5))
;                        (make-paddle (make-posn 400 580)))]
;           [else w])]
;        [else w])]))


;; BANG!
(big-bang WIDTH HEIGHT GRAIN BREAKOUT)
(on-redraw draw-world)
(on-tick-event tock)
(on-key-event move-paddle)

title: as drew said: a hairy macro
contents:
(defmacro defserver-callback (name args &body body)
  `(progn
     (defaction ,name ,args ,@body)
     (defmethod ,(callback-name name) ,args
       (let ((action-id (action-href-body (:component comp)
			  (,name comp))))
	 (<:as-is
	  ~%
	  (js:js*
	   `(setf ,(intern (format nil "~A.~A" (js-component-id comp) ',name))
		  (lambda ()
		    (dj_debug "calling server action")
		    (server.io.load-component ,action-id)
		    (dj_debug "server action ended.")
		    (return false)))))
	  ~%))))

(defserver-callback show-content ((self ajax-navigation) content)
  (setf window (context.window-component *context*))
  (setf content-widget (slot-value window 'content))
  (setf (content content-widget) content)
  (refresh-ajax-component content-widget t nil nil))

;;;; Expansion
(PROGN
 (DEFACTION SHOW-CONTENT
            ((SELF AJAX-NAVIGATION) CONTENT)
            (SETF WINDOW (CONTEXT.WINDOW-COMPONENT *CONTEXT*))
            (SETF CONTENT-WIDGET (SLOT-VALUE WINDOW 'CONTENT))
            (SETF (CONTENT CONTENT-WIDGET) CONTENT)
            (REFRESH-AJAX-COMPONENT CONTENT-WIDGET T NIL NIL))
 (DEFMETHOD JS-CALLBACK-SHOW-CONTENT
            ((SELF AJAX-NAVIGATION) CONTENT)
            (LET ((ACTION-ID
                   (ACTION-HREF-BODY (:COMPONENT COMP) (SHOW-CONTENT COMP))))
              (IT.BESE.YACLML.TAGS:AS-IS ~%
                                         (JS*
                                          `(SETF ,(INTERN
                                                   (FORMAT NIL "~A.~A"
 (JS-COMPONENT-ID COMP)
'SHOW-CONTENT))
(LAMBDA ,NIL
(DJ_DEBUG "calling server action")
(SERVER.IO.LOAD-COMPONENT ,ACTION-ID)
(DJ_DEBUG                                                      "server action ended.")                                                     (RETURN FALSE)))))
              ~%)))

" vim: set ts=8 sw=8 sts=8 et tw=80 :

" Extra terminal things
if ($TERM == "rxvt-unicode") && (&termencoding == "")
    set termencoding=utf-8
endif

"-----------------------------------------------------------------------
" settings
"-----------------------------------------------------------------------
set history=50
set encoding=utf8
set background=dark
set autoread<
set fileformat=unix
set fileencoding=utf8
set directory=$HOME/.vim/.vimswp/
set bdir=$HOME/.vim/.vimbak/
set noautowrite
set nostartofline
set errorformat=%f:%l:\ %m,In\ file\ included\ from\ %f:%l:,^I^Ifrom\ %f:%l%m
set helpheight=0
set helplang=en
set iskeyword=@,48-57,_,192-255,-,.
set makeef=$HOME/.vim/.vimtmp/m-error##
set path=.,./include,../include,/usr/include,/usr/local/include,~/
set report=0
set ruler
set noexpandtab
set report=0 " tell us when anything is changed via :...
set shortmess=atIA
set showmode
set sidescroll=3
"set smartcase
set tabstop=8 
set softtabstop=8
set shiftwidth=8
set smarttab " use tabs at the start of a line, spaces elsewhere
set splitbelow
set nowriteany
set enc=utf-8
set textwidth=80
set title
set ttyfast
set nocompatible

"-----------------------------------------------------------------------
" Enable folding, but by default make it act like folding is off, 
" because folding is annoying in anything but a few rare cases.
"-----------------------------------------------------------------------
set foldenable " Turn on folding
set foldmethod=indent " Make folding indent sensitive
set foldlevel=100 " Don't autofold anything (but I can still fold manually)
set foldopen-=search " don't open folds when you search into them
set foldopen-=undo " don't open folds when you undo stuff

" Disk write settings
set updatetime=30000
set updatecount=400
set swapsync=sync

" I have no idea what this is for
set ul=20

" Search builtin termcaps before external ones
set ttybuiltin

" Enable a smaller viminfo file
set viminfo='20,<50,s10
" Enable a nice big viminfo file
"set viminfo='1000,f1,:1000,/1000

" Make backspace delete lots of things
set backspace=indent,eol,start

set backup " Create backups
set showcmd " Show us the command we're typing
set showmatch " Highlight matching parens

" Search options: incremental search, do case things, highlight search
set incsearch
"set infercase
"set ignorecase
set hlsearch

" Show full tags when doing search completion
set showfulltag

" LaTeX Suite
set grepprg=grep\ -nH\ $*

set lazyredraw " Speed up macros

" No annoying error noises
set noerrorbells
set visualbell t_vb=
autocmd GUIEnter * set visualbell t_vb=

" Try to show at least three lines and two columns of context when
" scrolling
set scrolloff=3
set sidescrolloff=2

" Use the cool tab complete menu
set wildmenu
set wildignore=*.o,*~

" Allow edit buffers to be hidden
set hidden

" 1 height windows
set winminheight=1

syntax on

" Useful Abbreviations
iab xdate <c-r>=strftime("%d/%m/%y %H:%M:%S")<cr>

" Set our fonts
if has("gui_gtk")
	set guifont=terminus\ 10
elseif has("gui_running")
        set guifont=-xos4-terminus-medium-r-normal--14-140-72-72-c-80-iso10646-1
        "set guifont=-xos4-terminus-medium-r-normal--14-140-72-72-c-80-iso8859-1
endif

" Try to load a nice colourscheme
fun! LoadColourScheme(schemes)
	let l:schemes = a:schemes . ":"
	while l:schemes != ""
		let l:scheme = strpart(l:schemes, 0, stridx(l:schemes, ":"))
		let l:schemes = strpart(l:schemes, stridx(l:schemes, ":") + 1)
		try
			exec "colorscheme" l:scheme
			break
		catch
		endtry
	endwhile
endfun


if has("gui_running")
	call LoadColourScheme("inkpot:evening:darkblue:morning")
elseif has("gui_gtk")
	call LoadColourScheme("inkpot:evening:darkblue:morning")
elseif has('gui')
	call LoadColourScheme("inkpot:evening:darkblue:morning")
elseif ($TERM == "rxvt-unicode")
	call LoadColourScheme("inkpot:elflord:darkblue")
else 
	call LoadColourScheme("elflord:darkblue")
endif

" My GUI options
if has('gui')
	set guioptions-=a
	set guioptions-=g
	set guioptions-=i
	set guioptions-=r
	set guioptions-=M
	set guioptions-=L
	set guioptions-=T
end

" GUI mouse options
set mouse=a


" Do clever indent things. Don't make a # force column zero.
set autoindent
set smartindent
inoremap # X<BS>#

" Enable folds
" set foldenable
" set foldmethod=indent
" set foldlevel=1
" set foldcolumn=1

" Syntax when printing
set popt+=syntax:y

" Enable filetype settings
filetype on
filetype plugin on
filetype indent on



" Enable modelines only on secure vim versions
if (v:version == 603 && has("patch045")) || (v:version > 603)
	set modeline
else
	set nomodeline
endif

" set statusline=%F%m%r%h%w\ [FORMAT=%{&ff}]\ [TYPE=%Y]\ [ASCII=\%03.3b]\ [HEX=\%02.2B]\ [POS=%04l,%04v][%p%%]\ [LEN=%L]

" Nice statusbar
set laststatus=2
set statusline=
set statusline+=%-3.3n\                      " buffer number
set statusline+=%f\                          " file name
set statusline+=%h%m%r%w                     " flags
set statusline+=\[%{strlen(&ft)?&ft:'none'}, " filetype
set statusline+=%{&encoding},                " encoding
set statusline+=%{&fileformat}]              " file format

" set statusline+=\ %{VimBuddy()}          " vim buddy

set statusline+=%=                           " right align
set statusline+=0x%-8B\                      " current char
set statusline+=%-14.(%l,%c%V%)\ %<%P        " offset

" If possible, try to use a narrow number column.
if v:version >= 700
	try
		setlocal numberwidth=4
	catch
	endtry
endif

" Include $HOME in cdpath
let &cdpath=','.expand("$HOME")

set fillchars=fold:-

"-----------------------------------------------------------------------
" completion
"-----------------------------------------------------------------------
set dictionary=/usr/share/dict/words

" If we're in a wide window, enable line numbers.
fun! <SID>WindowWidth()
	if winwidth(0) < 75
        	setlocal nonumber
	else
        	setlocal number
	endif
endfun

" Force active window to the top of the screen without losing its size.
fun! <SID>WindowToTop()
	let l:h=winheight(0)
	wincmd K
	execute "resize" l:h
endfun

" Force active window to the bottom of the screen without losing its size.
fun! <SID>WindowToBottom()
	let l:h=winheight(0)
	wincmd J
	execute "resize" l:h
endfun

" My autocmds
augroup voidengineer
	autocmd!

	" Turn off search highlight when idle
	autocmd CursorHold * nohls | redraw
	" Automagic line numbers
	autocmd BufEnter * :call <SID>WindowWidth()

	" FIXME !!!
	" Update header in .vimrc and .bashrc before saving
	" autocmd BufWritePre *vimrc  :call <SID>UpdateRcHeader()
	" autocmd BufWritePre *bashrc :call <SID>UpdateRcHeader()

	" Always do a full syntax refresh
	autocmd BufEnter * syntax sync fromstart

	" For help files, move them to the top window and make <Return>
	" behave like <C-]> (jump to tag)
	autocmd FileType help :call <SID>WindowToTop()
	autocmd FileType help nmap <buffer> <Return> <C-]>

	" For the quickfix window, move it to the bottom
	autocmd FileType qf :3 wincmd _ | :call <SID>WindowToBottom()



	" bash-completion ftdetects
	autocmd BufNewFile,BufRead /*/*bash*completion*/*
		\ if expand("<amatch>") !~# "ChangeLog" |
		\     let b:is_bash = 1 | set filetype=sh |
		\ endif

	try
        	" if we have a vim which supports QuickFixCmdPost (patch by
        	" ciaranm, marked for inclusion in vim7), give us an error
        	" window after running make, grep etc, but only if results are
        	" available.
		autocmd QuickFixCmdPost * :cwindow 3
    	catch
	endtry
augroup END

"-----------------------------------------------------------------------
" mappings
"-----------------------------------------------------------------------
nmap   <silent> <S-Right>  :bnext<CR>

" Delete a buffer but keep layout
command! Kwbd enew|bw #
nmap     <C-w>!   :Kwbd<CR>

" Annoying default mappings
inoremap <S-Up>   <C-o>gk
inoremap <S-Down> <C-o>gj
noremap  <S-Up>   gk
noremap  <S-Down> gj


" Make <space> in normal mode go down a page rather than left a
" character
noremap <space> <C-f>

" Useful things from inside imode
inoremap <C-z>w <C-o>:w<CR>
inoremap <C-z>q <C-o>gq}<C-o>k<C-o>$

" Commonly used commands
nmap <silent> <F3> :silent nohlsearch<CR>
imap <silent> <F3> <C-o>:silent nohlsearch<CR>
nmap <F5> <C-w>c

" Keep window open, buffer delete
nmap <F4> :Kwbd<CR>
nmap <F7> :so %<CR>
nmap <F8> :make<CR>
nmap <F12> :pop<CR>

nmap <silent> <F2> :set tw=0<CR>
imap <silent> <F2> <C-o>:set tw=0<CR>
" Rot13
"map <F2> ggvgg?

" No fucking numbers, damnit!
nmap <silent> <F1> :set nonu<CR>
imap <silent> <F1> <C-o>:set nonu<CR>

" Insert a single char
noremap <Leader>i i<Space><Esc>r

" Split the line
nmap <Leader>n \i<CR>

" Pull the following line to the cursor position
noremap <Leader>J :s/\%#\(.*\)\n\(.*\)/\2\1<CR>

" In normal mode, jj escapes
inoremap jj <Esc>

" Select everything
noremap <Leader>gg ggVG

" Reformat everything
noremap <Leader>gq gggqG

" Reformat paragraph
noremap <Leader>gp gqap

" Clear lines
noremap <Leader>clr :s/^.*$//<CR>:nohls<CR>

" Delete blank lines
noremap <Leader>dbl :g/^$/d<CR>:nohls<CR>

" Enclose each selected line with markers
noremap <Leader>enc :<C-w>execute
            \ substitute(":'<,'>s/^.*/#&#/ \| :nohls", "#", input(">"), "g")<CR>

" Enable fancy % matching
runtime! macros/matchit.vim

" q: sucks
nmap q: :q

" set up some more useful digraphs
digraph ., 8230    " ellipsis ()

" command aliases, can't call these until after cmdalias.vim is loaded
au VimEnter * if exists("loaded_cmdalias") |
            \       call CmdAlias("mkdir",   "!mkdir") |
            \       call CmdAlias("cvs",     "!cvs") |
            \       call CmdAlias("svn",     "!svn") |
            \       call CmdAlias("commit",  "!svn commit -m \"") |
            \       call CmdAlias("upload",  "make upload") |
            \ endif

"-----------------------------------------------------------------------
" special less.sh and man modes
"-----------------------------------------------------------------------

fun! <SID>is_pager_mode()
    let l:ppidc = ""
    try
        if filereadable("/lib/libc.so.6")
            let l:ppid = libcallnr("/lib/libc.so.6", "getppid", "")
        elseif filereadable("/lib/libc.so.0")
            let l:ppid = libcallnr("/lib/libc.so.0", "getppid", "")
        else
            let l:ppid = ""
        endif
        let l:ppidc = system("ps -p " . l:ppid . " -o comm=")
        let l:ppidc = substitute(l:ppidc, "\\n", "", "g")
    catch
    endtry
    return l:ppidc ==# "less.sh" ||
                \ l:ppidc ==# "vimpager" ||
                \ l:ppidc ==# "manpager.sh" ||
                \ l:ppidc ==# "vimmanpager"
endfun
if <SID>is_pager_mode()
    " we're in vimpager / less.sh / man mode
    set laststatus=0
    set foldmethod=manual
    set foldlevel=99
    set nolist
endif

"-----------------------------------------------------------------------
" plugin / script / app settings
"-----------------------------------------------------------------------

" Perl specific options
let perl_include_pod=1
let perl_fold=1
let perl_fold_blocks=1

" Vim specific options
let g:vimsyntax_noerror=1

" Settings minibufexpl.vim
let g:miniBufExplModSelTarget = 1
let g:miniBufExplWinFixHeight = 1

" Settings for showmarks.vim
if has("gui_running")
    let g:showmarks_enable=1
else
    let g:showmarks_enable=0
    let loaded_showmarks=1
endif

autocmd VimEnter *
            \ if has('gui') |
            \        highlight ShowMarksHLl gui=bold guifg=#a0a0e0 guibg=#2e2e2e |
            \        highlight ShowMarksHLu gui=none guifg=#a0a0e0 guibg=#2e2e2e |
            \        highlight ShowMarksHLo gui=none guifg=#a0a0e0 guibg=#2e2e2e |
            \        highlight ShowMarksHLm gui=none guifg=#a0a0e0 guibg=#2e2e2e |
            \        highlight SignColumn   gui=none guifg=#f0f0f8 guibg=#2e2e2e |
            \    endif

" Settings for explorer.vim
let g:explHideFiles='^\.'

" Settings for netrw
let g:netrw_list_hide='^\.,\~$'

" Settings for :TOhtml
let html_number_lines=1
let html_use_css=1
let use_xhtml=1

" cscope settings
if has('cscope') && filereadable("/usr/bin/cscope")
	set csto=0
	set cscopetag
	set nocsverb
	if filereadable("cscope.out")
		cs add cscope.out
	endif
	set csverb
	let x = "sgctefd"
	while x != ""
		let y = strpart(x, 0, 1) | let x = strpart(x, 1)
		exec "nmap <C-j>" . y . " :cscope find " . y .
			\ " <C-R>=expand(\"\<cword\>\")<CR><CR>"
		exec "nmap <C-j><C-j>" . y . " :scscope find " . y .
			\ " <C-R>=expand(\"\<cword\>\")<CR><CR>"
	endwhile
	nmap <C-j>i      :cscope find i ^<C-R>=expand("<cword>")<CR><CR>
	nmap <C-j><C-j>i :scscope find i ^<C-R>=expand("<cword>")<CR><CR>
endif


"-----------------------------------------------------------------------
" final commands
"-----------------------------------------------------------------------

" turn off any existing search
au VimEnter * nohls

"-----------------------------------------------------------------------
" SOURCES
"-----------------------------------------------------------------------

map <Leader>b :MiniBufExplorer<cr>
map <Leader>c :CMiniBufExplorer<cr>
map <Leader>u :UMiniBufExplorer<cr>
map <Leader>t :TMiniBufExplorer<cr>

"-----------------------------------------------------------------------
" You can also call each of these features by typing the
" following in command mode:
"
"   :MiniBufExplorer    " Open and/or goto Explorer
"   :CMiniBufExplorer   " Close the Explorer if it's open
"   :UMiniBufExplorer   " Update Explorer without navigating
"   :TMiniBufExplorer   " Toggle the Explorer window open and 
"                         closed.
"-----------------------------------------------------------------------

" Transparent editing of gpg encrypted files.
augroup encrypted
    au!

    " First make sure nothing is written to ~/.viminfo 
    autocmd BufReadPre,FileReadPre      *.gpg set viminfo=
    " We don't want a swap file, as it writes unencrypted data to disk
    autocmd BufReadPre,FileReadPre      *.gpg set noswapfile
    " Switch to binary mode to read the encrypted file
    autocmd BufReadPre,FileReadPre      *.gpg set bin
    autocmd BufReadPre,FileReadPre      *.gpg let ch_save = &ch|set ch=2
    autocmd BufReadPost,FileReadPost    *.gpg '[,']!gpg --decrypt 2> /dev/null
    " Switch to normal mode for editing
    autocmd BufReadPost,FileReadPost    *.gpg set nobin
    autocmd BufReadPost,FileReadPost    *.gpg let &ch = ch_save|unlet ch_save
    autocmd BufReadPost,FileReadPost    *.gpg execute ":doautocmd BufReadPost " . expand("%:r")
    " Convert all text to encrypted text before writing
    autocmd BufWritePre,FileWritePre    *.gpg   '[,']!gpg --default-recipient-self -ae 2>/dev/null
    " Undo the encryption and back in the normal text, directly after the file has been written.
    autocmd BufWritePost,FileWritePost  *.gpg   u
augroup END


"-----------------------------------------------------------------------
" Settings for taglist.vim 
"
" 	Ctags cruft 
"-----------------------------------------------------------------------

let Tlist_Sort_Type = "name" " order by 
let Tlist_Use_Right_Window=1
let Tlist_Auto_Open=0
let Tlist_Enable_Fold_Column=0
let Tlist_Compact_Format=1
let Tlist_WinWidth=28
let Tlist_Exit_OnlyWindow=1
let Tlist_File_Fold_Auto_Close = 1
nnoremap <silent> <F9> :Tlist<CR>


"
" File type specific settings
"

" autocommands_loaded is a nifty trick found in :he au
if !exists("autocommands_loaded")
        let autocommands_loaded = 1
        if has("autocmd")
                autocmd BufNewFile,BufRead *.c,*.h setlocal cindent modeline 
                "comments=sl:/*,mb: *,elx: */
                " set makeprg=gcc\ foo.c
                " todo: find a way to make makeprg dynamic according to current file name

                " Lisp
                autocmd BufNewFile,BufRead *.lsp,*.lisp setlocal autoindent lisp showmatch | colorscheme darkblue
                " For svn-commit, don't create backups
                autocmd BufRead svn-commit.tmp setlocal nobackup
                " Detect procmailrc
                autocmd BufRead procmailrc setfiletype procmail
                " Mutt foo
                autocmd BufNewFile,BufRead mutt*,.followup source $HOME/.vim/tools/email.vim
                " Config files
                autocmd BufRead *.conf,config setlocal nonumber tw=0 
                autocmd BufRead rc.*,*.rc setlocal nonumber tw=0
                " Text Files
                autocmd BufNewFile,BufRead *.txt setlocal nonumber 
                autocmd BufNewFile,BufRead *.edc setlocal nonumber ts=4 sts=4
                autocmd BufNewFile,BufRead *.ebuild setlocal syntax=ebuild
                autocmd BufNewFile,BufRead *.sh setlocal sw=4 sts=4 et tw=80
        endif
endif

# FUNCTIONS
function bx() { BitchX; }

function mine() { # goto my cruft

    	[[ -x /usr/bin/devtodo && -r .todo ]] && devtodo ${TODO_OPTS}
}
function pskill() { # a better killall
	local pid
	pid=$(ps -ax | grep $1 | grep -v grep | gawk '{print $1}')
	echo -n "killing $1 (process $pid)..."
	kill -9 $pid

}

function ripit() {
	cdparanoia -B 1- --never-skip=50 --force-cdrom-device /dev/sg0 ;
}

if [ -f /etc/gentoo-release ] ; then
explainuseflag() {
  sed -ne "s,^\([^ ]*:\)\?$1 - ,,p" \
    /usr/portage/profiles/use.desc \
    /usr/portage/profiles/use.local.desc
}
fi

if [ -f /etc/gentoo-release ] ; then

# find either a cvs co of gentoo's portage module or the portage directory, and
# echo the result.
eportdir() {
    # does fast cache magic. portageq in particular is really slow... this makes
    # subsequent calls to eportdir() pretty much instantaneous, as opposed to
    # taking several seconds.
    if [[ -n "${PORTDIR_CACHE}" ]] ; then
        echo "${PORTDIR_CACHE}"
    elif [[ -d ${HOME}/cvs/portage ]] ; then
        PORTDIR_CACHE="${HOME}/cvs/portage"
        eportdir
    elif [[ -d /usr/portage ]] ; then
        PORTDIR_CACHE="/usr/portage"
        eportdir
    else
        PORTDIR_CACHE="$(portageq portdir )"
        eportdir
    fi
}

# find a given ebuild. based upon code by agriffis. does some fancy prediction,
# so it will find categories if necessary (eg efind sparc-dev-sources will find
# sys-kernel/sparc-dev-sources, and does partial name matching). prints the
# result in the form category/package .
efind() {
    local efinddir cat pkg
    efinddir=$(eportdir)

    case $1 in
        *-*/*)
            pkg=${1##*/}
            cat=${1%/*}
            ;;

        ?*)
            pkg=${1}
            cat=$(echo1 ${efinddir}/*-*/${pkg}/*.ebuild)
            [[ -f $cat ]] || cat=$(echo1 ${efinddir}/*-*/${pkg}*/*.ebuild)
            [[ -f $cat ]] || cat=$(echo1 ${efinddir}/*-*/*${pkg}/*.ebuild)
            [[ -f $cat ]] || cat=$(echo1 ${efinddir}/*-*/*${pkg}*/*.ebuild)
            if [[ ! -f $cat ]]; then
                return 1
            fi
            pkg=${cat%/*}
            pkg=${pkg##*/}
            cat=${cat#${efinddir}/}
            cat=${cat%%/*}
        ;;
    esac

    echo ${cat}/${pkg}
}

# guesses who is to blame for a given package. uses metadata.xml if it's
# available. if not, it will try to use cvs log to determine who commited the
# ebuilds (only if a cvs co is available, of course...)
ewho() {
    local pc d metadata f

    pc=$(efind $*)
    d=$(eportdir)
    f=0

    if [[ $pc == "" ]] ; then
        echo "nothing found for $*"
        return 1
    fi

    metadata="${d}/${pc}/metadata.xml"
    if [[ -f "${metadata}" ]] ; then
        echo "metadata.xml says:"
        sed -ne 's,^.*<herd>\([^<]*\)</herd>.*,  herd:  \1,p' \
            "${metadata}"
        sed -ne 's,^.*<email>\([^<]*\)@[^<]*</email>.*,  dev:   \1,p' \
            "${metadata}"
        f=1
    fi

    if [[ -d ${d}/${pc}/CVS ]] ; then
        echo "CVS log says:"
        pushd ${d}/${pc} > /dev/null
        for e in *.ebuild ; do
            echo -n "${e}: "
            cvs log ${e} | sed -e '1,/^revision 1\.1$/d' | sed -e '2,$d' \
                -e "s-^.*author: --" -e 's-;.*--'
        done
        popd > /dev/null
        f=1
    fi

    if [[ f == 0 ]] ; then
        echo "Nothing found, so blame seemant"
        return 1
    fi
    return 0
}

# change to an ebuild's directory.
ecd() {
    local pc d

    pc=$(efind $*)
    d=$(eportdir)

    if [[ $pc == "" ]] ; then
        echo "nothing found for $*"
        return 1
    fi

    cd ${d}/${pc}
}

# is a box alive?
isalive() {
    ping -c1 $1
    return $?
}

# run on all boxes
runall() {
    local s
    for s in $(<${HOME}/servers ) ; do
        if [[ `isalive $s` ]] ; then
            echo -e "$(hostcolour $s)${s}\033[00m"
            ssh $s $*
        fi
    done
}

eshowkw() {
    local x y e v p a k l

    l=$(eportdir )/profiles
    for x in $(seq 1 5) ; do
        printf "%-18s| " ""
        for a in $(<${l}/arch.list ) ; do
            printf "%1s%1s " "${a:$((${x} - 1)):1}" "${a:$((5 + (${x} - 1))):1}"
        done
        echo ""
    done

    printf "%-18s+" "------------------"
    for a in $(<${l}/arch.list ) ; do
        printf "%3s" "---"
    done
    echo ""

    p=`pwd` ; p=${p##*/}
    for e in *.ebuild ; do
        v=${e%%.ebuild} ; v=${v##${p}-}
        printf "%-18s| " ${v}
        for a in $(< ${l}/arch.list ) ; do
            k=$(sed -ne "s/^KEYWORDS=.*\([-~ \"]${a}[^a-zA-Z0-9\-]\).*/\1/1p" $e)
            case "$k" in
                ~*)
                    echo -ne "\033[01;33m~  "
                    ;;
                -*)
                    echo -ne "\033[01;31m-  "
                    ;;
                ?*)
                    echo -ne "\033[01;34m+  "
                ;;
                *)
                    grep 'KEYWORDS=.*-\*' ${e} > /dev/null \
                        && printf "\033[01;31m-* " \
                        || printf "   "
                ;;
            esac
        done
        echo -e "\033[00m"
    done
}

edesc() {
    cat *.ebuild | sed -ne 's-^DESCRIPTION="\(.*\)".*-\1-1p' | \
        sort | uniq
}

ewww() {
    cat *.ebuild | sed -ne 's-^HOMEPAGE="\(.*\)".*-\1-1p' | \
        sort | uniq
}

fi

svnew() {
    [[ -z "$1" ]] && ( echo "need a parameter" ; return 1 )
    svnadmin create ${SVNDIR}/$1 && \
        svn checkout file://${SVNDIR}/$1
}

return 0

title: segment intersection
contents:
(defun segments-intersect-p (xa ya xb yb xc yc xd yd)
  "True if segment AB properly intersects CD (in a non-vertex point).
   False if the segments are disjoint.
   Undefined in case of tangent, vertex in common, collinear, etc."
  (let* ((xab (- xb xa)) ;Delta-x for AB
         (yab (- yb ya))
         (xcd (- xd xc))
         (ycd (- yd yc))
         (dab (- (* xa yb) (* xb ya))) ;some kind of determinant
         (dcd (- (* xc yd) (* xd yc)))
         (dn  (- (* xcd yab) (* xab ycd))) ;denominator of x= and y=
         (slope-ab (if (zerop xab) :vert (/ yab xab)))
         (slope-cd (if (zerop xcd) :vert (/ ycd xcd))))
    (unless (equal slope-ab slope-cd)
      (let ((x (/ (- (* xcd dab) (* xab dcd)) dn))
            (y (/ (- (* ycd dab) (* yab dcd)) dn)))
        (and (or (<= xa x xb) (<= xb x xa))
             (or (<= xc x xd) (<= xd x xc))
             (or (<= ya y yb) (<= yb y ya))
             (or (<= yc y yd) (<= yd y yc)))))))

(deftest segint-1 (segments-intersect-p 0 0 1 1  0 1 1 0) t) ;x shaped
(deftest segint-2 (segments-intersect-p 0 1 2 1  1 0 1 2) t) ;+ shaped
(deftest segint-3 (segments-intersect-p 0 0 3 1  1 1 3 0) t) ;random crossing
(deftest segint-4 (segments-intersect-p 0 0 3 1  0 1 3 2) nil) ;parallel
(deftest segint-5 (segments-intersect-p 0 0 3 1  0 1 2 1) nil) ;random disjoint

title: reflect
contents:
;; Alexander Annese and Kyle Obernautervaunhenfunkr
;; FINAL PROJECT
;; BREAKOUT

(define-struct vec (x y))
;; A Vec is a (make-vec Num Num)

(define-struct ball (pos vel))
;; A Ball is a (make-ball Posn Vec)

(define-struct brick (pos))
;; A Brick is a (make-brick Posn)

(define-struct paddle (pos))
;; A Paddle is a (make-paddle Posn)

;; A KeyEvent is one of: 
;; -- Char (char?)
;; -- Symbol (symbol?)

(define-struct world (ball brick paddle))
;; A World is (make-world (Ball [Listof Brick] Paddle)

(define WIDTH 800)
(define HEIGHT 600)
(define GRAIN 0.01)
(define BALL-RAD 5)
(define BALL-IMG (circle BALL-RAD 'solid 'red))
(define INIT-BALL false)
(define PADDLE (overlay (rectangle 100 10 'solid 'black)
                        (rectangle 100 10 'outline 'green)))
(define BRICK (overlay (rectangle 50 20 'solid 'blue)
                       (rectangle 50 20 'outline 'black)))

;; scenerender : [Listof Brick] Scene -> Scene
(define (scenerender x s)
  (cond 
    [(empty? x) s]
    [else
     (brickrender (first x) (scenerender (rest x) s))]))

;; listrender : [Listof [Listof Bricks]] -> [Listof Bricks]
(define (listrender x)
  (cond
    [(empty? x) x]
    [else
     (append (first x) 
             (listrender (rest x)))]))

;; brickrender : Brick Scene -> Scene
(define (brickrender x s)
  (place-image BRICK
               (posn-x (brick-pos x))
               (posn-y (brick-pos x))
               s))   

;; build-row : Num Num -> [Listof Brick]
(define (build-row y n)
  (build-list n 
              (lambda (x) 
                (make-brick (make-posn (+ 45 (* 55 x)) 
                                       (+ 20 (* 30 y)))))))

;; build-rows : Num Num -> [Listof [Listof Bricks]]
(define (build-rows x n)
  (build-list n 
              (lambda (y)
                (build-row y x))))

(define BREAKOUT (make-world (make-ball (make-posn 300 300)
                                        (make-vec 2 5))
                             (listrender (build-rows 14 5))
                             (make-paddle (make-posn 400 580))))

;; draw-world : World -> Scene
;; draws the world
(define (draw-world world)
  (local ((define ballpos (ball-pos (world-ball world)))
          (define paddlepos (paddle-pos (world-paddle world)))) 
    (overlay 
     (scenerender (world-brick world) (empty-scene WIDTH HEIGHT))
     (place-image PADDLE
                  (posn-x paddlepos)
                  (posn-y paddlepos)
                  (empty-scene WIDTH HEIGHT))
     (place-image BALL-IMG 
                  (posn-x ballpos) 
                  (posn-y ballpos)
                  (empty-scene WIDTH HEIGHT)))))

;; tock : World -> World
;; applies effects of a clock tick to ball.
;; In ball world, this means if moving collides with a wall, 
;; then don't move, just invert velocity.  Otherwise move.
(define (tock world)
  (local ((define new-ball (move-ball (world-ball world)))
          (define new-bricks (world-brick world))
          (define new-paddle (world-paddle world))
          (define new-world (make-world new-ball new-bricks new-paddle))
          (define new-pos (ball-pos new-ball))
          (define cur-pos (ball-pos (world-ball world)))
          (define vel (ball-vel (world-ball world)))
          (define px (posn-x new-pos))
          (define py (posn-y new-pos)))
    (cond 
      [(ball-hit-paddle? world)
       (make-world (make-ball cur-pos (arcreflect vel new-paddle (world-ball world) new-ball)) 
                   new-bricks
                   new-paddle)]
      [(or (< px (+ 0 BALL-RAD)) 
           (> px (- WIDTH BALL-RAD)))
       (make-world (make-ball cur-pos (make-vec (- (vec-x vel)) 
                                                (vec-y vel)))
                   new-bricks
                   new-paddle)]
      [(< py (+ 0 BALL-RAD))           
       (make-world (make-ball cur-pos (make-vec (vec-x vel) 
                                                (- (vec-y vel))))
                   new-bricks
                   new-paddle)]
      [(> py (- HEIGHT BALL-RAD))
       BREAKOUT]
      [else 
       new-world])))


(define (arcreflect vel paddle oldball newball)
  (cond
    [(< (posn-x (ball-pos newball))
        (+ -50 (posn-x (paddle-pos paddle))))
     (cond
       [(< (posn-x oldball)
           (posn-x newball))
        (make-vec (* -1 (posn-x (ball-pos newball)))
                  (* -1 (posn-x (ball-pos newball))))]
       [else 
        (make-vec (* 1 (posn-x (ball-pos newball))))])]
    [else
     (cond
       [(< (posn-x (ball-pos oldball))
           (posn-x (ball-pos newball)))
        (make-vec (* 1 (posn-x (ball-pos newball)))
                  5)]
       [else
        (make-vec (* -1 (posn-x (ball-pos paddle)))
                  5)])]))


;; arcreflect : World -> Vel
;; takes in a world and a velocity and produces the new velocity based on
;; where it hit the paddle
(define (arcreflect.v0 w)
  (cond
    [(< (posn-x (move-ball (ball-pos (world-ball w)))) 
        (+ -50 (posn-x (paddle-pos (world-paddle w)))))
     (cond
       [(< (posn-x (ball-pos (world-ball w)))
           (posn-x (move-ball (ball-pos (world-ball w)))))
        (make-vec (* -1 (posn-x (paddle-pos (world-ball w))))
                  5)]
       [else
        (make-vec (* 1 (posn-x (paddle-pos (world-ball w)))))])]
    [else
     (cond
       [(< (posn-x (ball-pos (world-ball w)))
           (posn-x (move-ball (ball-pos (world-ball w)))))
        (make-vec (* 1 (posn-x (paddle-pos (world-ball w))))
                  5)])]))

;(equal? (arcreflect (make-vec 2 5)




;; move-ball : Ball -> Ball
;; moves the ball, assuming it moves according to its velocity
(define (move-ball b)
  (local ((define vel (ball-vel b))
          (define pos (ball-pos b))
          (define new-pos (make-posn (+ (vec-x vel) (posn-x pos)) 
                                     (+ (vec-y vel) (posn-y pos)))))
    (make-ball new-pos vel)))

;;ball-hit-paddle? : WORLD -> boolean
;;tests if ball hits paddle
(define (ball-hit-paddle? w)
  (cond
    [(and 
      (>= (posn-x (ball-pos (move-ball (world-ball w)))) 
          (+ -50 (posn-x (paddle-pos (world-paddle w)))))
      
      (<= (posn-x (ball-pos (move-ball (world-ball w)))) 
          (+ 50 (posn-x (paddle-pos (world-paddle w)))))
      
      (>= (posn-y (ball-pos (move-ball (world-ball w)))) 
          (+ -5 (posn-y (paddle-pos (world-paddle w)))))
      
      (<= (posn-y (ball-pos (move-ball (world-ball w)))) 
          (posn-y (paddle-pos (world-paddle w))))) true] 
    [else false]))

;; move-paddle : World KeyEvent -> World
;; produces the next world based on w and ke
(define (move-paddle w ke)
  (cond ;; Two variants
    [(symbol? ke)
     (cond ;; 2 cases
       ;; move left
       [(symbol=? 'left ke) (make-world (world-ball w)
                                        (world-brick w)
                                        (make-paddle 
                                         (make-posn       
                                          (- (posn-x (paddle-pos (world-paddle w))) 
                                             10)
                                          (posn-y (paddle-pos (world-paddle w))))))]
       ;; move right
       [(symbol=? 'right ke) (make-world (world-ball w)
                                         (world-brick w)
                                         (make-paddle 
                                          (make-posn       
                                           (+ (posn-x (paddle-pos (world-paddle w))) 
                                              10)
                                           (posn-y (paddle-pos (world-paddle w))))))]
       
       [else w])]
    [else w]))
;       (cond
;        [(char=? #\space ke)
;         (cond
;           [(= 0 (vec-x (ball-vel (world-ball w))))
;            (make-world (make-ball (make-posn 400 570) 
;                                   (make-vec 2 5))
;                        (listrender (build-rows 14 5))
;                        (make-paddle (make-posn 400 580)))]
;           [else w])]
;        [else w])]))


;; BANG!
(big-bang WIDTH HEIGHT GRAIN BREAKOUT)
(on-redraw draw-world)
(on-tick-event tock)
(on-key-event move-paddle)

title: document
contents:
\documentclass[12pt]{article}
\usepackage{amssymb}
\usepackage{verbatim}
\newenvironment{code}{\footnotesize\verbatim}{\endverbatim\normalsize}
\begin{document}
\begin{code}
module DFT where
import Control.Monad
import Data.List
import qualified Data.Set as Set
import Data.Set (Set)
import Roots
import Utilities
import Expression

dftMatrix n = [[root n (i*j) | i <- [0..n-1]] | j <- [0..n-1]]
test1 = take 8 . drop 8 $ dftMatrix 24
\end{code}

Given a vector $x = (x_0,\dots,x_{n-1})$ in $\mathbb{C}^n$,
and a divisor $d$ of $n$, let
$x_{[d]} = (x_0,x_d,x_{2d},\dots,x_{\lfloor {n\over d}\rfloor d})$
and
$x_{[d]+k} = (x_k, x_{d+k}, x_{2d+k},\dots, x_{\lfloor {n\over d}\rfloor d + k})$.

\begin{code}
slice d xs = [x | (i, x) <- zip [0..] xs, i `mod` d == 0]
slice' d k = slice d . drop k
slices d xs = map (($ xs) . slice' d) [0..d-1]
\end{code}

Given a (partial) DFT of size $n$, and a divisor $d$ of $n$, and two rows
$x$ and $y$, we say that $x$ is directly $d$-connected to $y$ and write
$x \approx_d y$
if for some $n^\mathrm{th}$ root of unity $\omega_n^i$, and all $k$,
$x_{[d]+k} = \omega_n^i y_{[d]+k}$ 
and conjugate $d$-connected to $y$ and write $x \sim_d y$ if
$x_{[d]+k} = \omega_n^i \overline{y_{[d]+k}}$.

If neither of these is true we say that $x$ and $y$ are $d$-disconnected.

Note that it is sufficient to check just $k = 0$, since the other slices will
just be rotations of the first.

\begin{code}
data ConnectionType = Direct | Conjugate
    deriving (Read,Show,Eq,Enum,Ord)

connectionType :: Int -> [Root] -> [Root] -> Maybe ConnectionType
connectionType d xs ys =
    if xd == yd -- could stop after comparing first 2.
        then Just Direct
        else if xd == map invRoot yd
                then Just Conjugate
                else Nothing
  where normal xs = correct (slice d xs)
        correct (x:xs) = map (.*. (invRoot x)) (x:xs)
        [xd,yd] = map normal [xs,ys]
\end{code}

Now, given a DFT matrix, we'd like to determine information about which rows
are connected. Obviously, direct connection is an equivalence relation.
Conjugate connection is symmetric, antireflexive, and
has the property that if $x \sim_d y$ and $y \sim_d z$,
then $x \approx_d z$, and if $x \approx_d y$ and $y \sim_d z$, then
$x \sim_d z$.
\begin{code}

data Connection = Connection { connType :: ConnectionType,
                               connDivisor :: Int,
                               connRows :: Set Int }
   deriving (Show, Eq)

findConnections :: Int -> [[Root]] -> [Connection]
findConnections n m = do
    d <- drop 1 (divisors n)
    let ds = do c <- filter ((> 1) . length) $ findClasses m d
                return $ Connection Direct d (Set.fromList c)
        cs = do (Conjugate, (i,j)) <- findConnectionsPairwise m d
                return $ Connection Conjugate d (Set.fromList [i,j])
    ds ++ cs
  where     
    findConnectionsPairwise :: [[Root]] -> Int -> [(ConnectionType, (Int,Int))]
    findConnectionsPairwise m d = do
        (i,xs:xss) <- zip [0..] (tails m)
        (j,ys) <- zip [i+1..] xss
        case connectionType d xs ys of
            Nothing -> []
            Just c -> return $ (c, (i,j))

    findClasses :: [[Root]] -> Int -> [[Int]]
    findClasses m d = foldr connect (map (:[]) [0..n-1])
                        [p | (Direct, p) <- findConnectionsPairwise m d]
        where n = length m
              connect (i,j) xs = maybe xs id $ do
                  (y,ys) <- extract (elem i) xs
                  (z,zs) <- extract (elem j) ys
                  return $ (y++z) : zs
\end{code}

One important thing to note is that under the assumption of a zero register,
and possibly a $-1$ register, complex multiplication by elements of
$C_4 = \{1, i, -1, -i\}$ is free in terms of computational cost, since this
only involves possibly negating the real or imaginary part of the number,
and rather than performing the negation explicitly, future operations can be
modified so as to treat various inputs as negated. 

The fact that multiplication by elements of $C_4$ is essentially free allows
us to only load constants for components of complex values in the first
quadrant, that is, where the real and imaginary parts are both positive.

Suppose that we have $c_i = b a_i$, $0 \leq i \leq k-1$
and we have the program:
\begin{eqnarray*}
u_1 & \leftarrow & \sum_{i=0}^{k-1} a_i x_i \\
u_2 & \leftarrow & c_j x_j \\
\end{eqnarray*}
which does $k-1$ complex additions, and $k+1$ complex multiplications.

We can do trivial common subexpression elimination as:
\begin{eqnarray*}
v & \leftarrow & a_j x_j \\
u_1 & \leftarrow & v + \sum_{i = 0\atop i \not= j}^{k-1} a_i x_i \\
u_2 & \leftarrow & b v \\
\end{eqnarray*}
resulting in a program which also does $k-1$ complex additions and
$k+1$ complex multiplications.

The same number of complex additions and multiplications have occured,
so in the general case, we will have done no harm. However, if $c_j$ was
an element of $C_4$ and $b$ is not, then the amount of
work on the level of real variables has gone up. On the other hand, if
$b \in C_4$, but $c_j$ is not, then we save work.

Hence, we should always common out single multiplications when their ratio
is in $C_4$, and never otherwise (though there is no harm if there are no
elements of $C_4$ involved anywhere).

Now suppose that any larger number of terms may be commoned out:
\begin{eqnarray*}
u_1 & \leftarrow & \sum_{i=0}^{k-1} a_i x_i \\
u_2 & \leftarrow & \sum_{i=0}^{n-1} c_{j_i} x_{j_i} \\
\end{eqnarray*}
which does $(k-1) + (n-1) = k + n - 2$ complex additions,
and $k + n$ complex multiplications.

We may transform the program as:
\begin{eqnarray*}
v & \leftarrow & \sum_{i=0}^{n-1} a_{j_i} x_{j_i} \\
u_1 & \leftarrow & v + \sum_{i = 0\atop i \not\in j}^{k-1} a_i x_i \\
u_2 & \leftarrow & b v \\
\end{eqnarray*}
This now has $(n-1) + (1 + (k-n)) = k$ complex additions, and
$n + (k-n) + 1 = k + 1$ complex multiplications.

So on the real-valued level, we save $2 (k-2)$ instructions for addition.
However, for multiplication, in the worst case, where all $c_{j_i}$ are
elements of $C_4$, and $b$ is not, and $2 (k-2)$ is less than the cost of
a complex multiplication, we will be doing more harm than good.

Also, we would always prefer to compute multiplications by elements of $C_4$.

So, if more $c_{j_i}$ were elements of $C_4$ than elements of $a_{j_i}$, then
we want to compute with them instead, giving the program:
\begin{eqnarray*}
v & \leftarrow & \sum_{i=0}^{n-1} c_{j_i} x_{j_i} \\
u_1 & \leftarrow & b^{-1} v + \sum_{i = 0\atop i \not\in j}^{k-1} a_i x_i \\
u_2 & \leftarrow & v \\
\end{eqnarray*}

It might occur to us to try to locate a coset of $C_4$ or failing that,
a subset thereof, within the $c_{j_i}$ and factor out the inverse of a
coset representative. This is a good tactic, and will get as much gain
as possible without splitting the subexpression further.

If we make the additional assumption that the coefficients of our common
subexpression are a coset of some subgroup of the circle, (that is, they
are symmetrical about the origin), then we additionally get that factoring
out any one of the coefficients will make as much of $C_4$ as possible
available to us. If it's a coset of size $d$, and $4 | d$, then we will
get a copy of $C_4$, and if $2 | d$, a copy of $C_2$.

\end{document}

title: SET! and DEFINE
contents:
(set! fnord 5)   ; Error, FNORD doesn't exist
(define fnord 5) ; Now fnord exists,
(set! fnord 23)  ; so we can midify it
(define fnord 8) ; We can also re-define it. This is the only case
                 ; where DEFINE is equivalent to SET!.

;; Within a function, this completely changes:

(define (foo fnord kallisti)
  (define fnord 23)
  (set! kallisti 5)
  (list fnord kallist))

;; This is syntactic sugar, and thus, completely equivalent to:

(define (foo fnord kallisti)
  (letrec ((fnord 23))  ; FNORD is shadowed, not modified
    (set! kallisti 5)   ; KALLISTI is modified
    (list fnord kallisti)))

title: Stuff
contents:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
{-| Module      : Main
    Copyright   : Graviton Studios 2006
    License     : All Rights Reserved

    Maintainer  : ryant5000@yahoo.com
    Stability   : alpha
    Portability : universal
-}
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

module Main where

import Data.Array.IArray
import Data.Array.Diff
import Data.Array.IO
import Data.Int
import Data.IORef
import qualified Graphics.UI.GLUT as GLUT
import qualified Graphics.Rendering.OpenGL as OpenGL
import System.Exit
import Data.Char
import System.Time

{-
class Diff d where
	mutate :: d -> m -> (m, d)
	
data Diff d => Transition m d = Transition {
	towardsCached :: Node m d,
	diff :: d
	}
	
type Node m d = Either (Transition m d) (m)
-}

{-
class ID i where
	find :: c -> i -> o

data Ship = Ship {
	--hull :: HullID,
	--crewRace :: RaceID,
	--items :: [ItemID]
	}
	
type Board = Array (Int32, Int32) Cell

data Cell = Cell {
	ships :: ShipID a => [a]
	}
-}

data Vector a = Vector3 a a a
	
data Scene a = Triangle (Vector a) (Vector a) (Vector a)
	| Rotated a (Vector a) (Scene a)
	| Translated (Vector a) (Scene a)
	| Scaled (Vector a) (Scene a)
	
class OpenGLScene ogls where
	render :: ogls -> IO ()
	
instance (OpenGL.VertexComponent a, OpenGL.MatrixComponent a) => OpenGLScene (Scene a) where
	render (Triangle (Vector3 ax ay az) (Vector3 bx by bz) (Vector3 cx cy cz)) = OpenGL.renderPrimitive OpenGL.Triangles $ mapM_ OpenGL.vertex [(OpenGL.Vertex3 ax ay az), (OpenGL.Vertex3 bx by bz), (OpenGL.Vertex3 cx cy cz)]
	render (Rotated angle (Vector3 x y z) child) = OpenGL.preservingMatrix (do { OpenGL.rotate angle (OpenGL.Vector3 x y z) ; render child })
	
data Key = UpArrow
	| DownArrow
	| LeftArrow
	| RightArrow

data KeyTransition = Down
	| Up

data Message = Keystroke Key KeyTransition

data DrawFrameStimulus = DrawFrameStimulus

class ReactionGraph graph stimulus response where
	run :: graph -> stimulus -> response

data RotatedTriangle a = RotatedTriangle (Vector a) (Vector a) (Vector a) a a

instance Num t => ReactionGraph (RotatedTriangle t) Message (RotatedTriangle t) where
	run (RotatedTriangle a b c pitch yaw) message = RotatedTriangle a b c newpitch newyaw where
		newpitch = case message of
			(Keystroke UpArrow Down) -> pitch + 10
			(Keystroke DownArrow Down) -> pitch - 10
			_ -> pitch
		newyaw = case message of
			(Keystroke LeftArrow Down) -> yaw + 10
			(Keystroke RightArrow Down) -> yaw - 10
			_ -> yaw
	
instance Num t => ReactionGraph (RotatedTriangle t) DrawFrameStimulus (Scene t) where
	run (RotatedTriangle a b c pitch yaw) _ = Rotated pitch (Vector3 1 0 0) $ Rotated yaw (Vector3 0 1 0) $ Triangle a b c

main :: IO ()
main = do
	(progName, _) <- GLUT.getArgsAndInitialize
	GLUT.initialDisplayMode GLUT.$= [GLUT.RGBAMode, GLUT.DoubleBuffered, GLUT.WithDepthBuffer, GLUT.WithAlphaComponent]
	GLUT.createWindow progName
	rgRef <- newIORef $ RotatedTriangle (Vector3 (-0.5) 0 0) (Vector3 0.5 0 0) (Vector3 0 1 0) 0 (0 :: Double)
	GLUT.displayCallback GLUT.$= doDisplay rgRef (render :: (Scene Double) -> IO ())
	GLUT.idleCallback GLUT.$= Just (doDisplay rgRef (render :: (Scene Double) -> IO ()))
	GLUT.keyboardMouseCallback GLUT.$= Just (onKey rgRef)
	GLUT.clearColor GLUT.$= (GLUT.Color4 0 0 0 0)
	GLUT.matrixMode GLUT.$= GLUT.Projection
	OpenGL.depthFunc OpenGL.$= Just OpenGL.Less
	OpenGL.blendFunc OpenGL.$= (OpenGL.SrcAlpha, OpenGL.OneMinusSrcAlpha)
	OpenGL.blend OpenGL.$= OpenGL.Enabled
	GLUT.mainLoop

doDisplay :: (ReactionGraph a DrawFrameStimulus b) => IORef a -> (b -> IO c) -> GLUT.DisplayCallback
doDisplay rgRef renderFunc = do
--	(TOD seconds picoseconds) <- getClockTime
	OpenGL.loadIdentity
	OpenGL.frustum (-1) 1 (-1) 1 1 3
	OpenGL.translate (OpenGL.Vector3 0 0 (-2 :: Double))
	GLUT.clear [GLUT.ColorBuffer, GLUT.DepthBuffer]
	OpenGL.currentColor OpenGL.$= (OpenGL.Color4 1 1 1 1)
	rg <- readIORef rgRef
	renderFunc $ run rg DrawFrameStimulus
	OpenGL.currentColor OpenGL.$= (OpenGL.Color4 0 1 0 0.5)
	OpenGL.renderPrimitive OpenGL.TriangleStrip $ do
		OpenGL.vertex $ OpenGL.Vertex3 (-10) (-10) (0 :: Double)
		OpenGL.vertex $ OpenGL.Vertex3 10 (-10) (0 :: Double)
		OpenGL.vertex $ OpenGL.Vertex3 (-10) 10 (0 :: Double)
		OpenGL.vertex $ OpenGL.Vertex3 10 10 (0 :: Double)
	GLUT.swapBuffers

onKey :: (ReactionGraph a Message a) => IORef a -> GLUT.KeyboardMouseCallback
onKey _ (GLUT.Char '\27') _ (GLUT.Modifiers {GLUT.shift = GLUT.Up, GLUT.ctrl = GLUT.Up, GLUT.alt = GLUT.Up}) _ = exitWith ExitSuccess
onKey rgRef (GLUT.Char x) state _ _ = do
	rg <- readIORef rgRef
	maybe (return ()) (\k -> writeIORef rgRef $ run rg $ Keystroke k s) key where 
	key = case x of
		'w' -> Just UpArrow
		's' -> Just DownArrow
		'a' -> Just LeftArrow
		'd' -> Just RightArrow
		_ -> Nothing
	s = case state of
		GLUT.Up -> Up
		GLUT.Down -> Down
onKey _ _ _ _ _ = return ()

data Vector a = Vector3 a a a
	
data Scene a = Triangle (Vector a) (Vector a) (Vector a)
	| Rotated a (Vector a) (Scene a)
	| Translated (Vector a) (Scene a)
	| Scaled (Vector a) (Scene a)
	
class OpenGLScene ogls where
	render :: ogls -> IO ()
	
instance (OpenGL.VertexComponent a, OpenGL.MatrixComponent a) => OpenGLScene (Scene a) where
	render (Triangle (Vector3 ax ay az) (Vector3 bx by bz) (Vector3 cx cy cz)) = OpenGL.renderPrimitive OpenGL.Triangles $ mapM_ OpenGL.vertex [(OpenGL.Vertex3 ax ay az), (OpenGL.Vertex3 bx by bz), (OpenGL.Vertex3 cx cy cz)]
	render (Rotated angle (Vector3 x y z) child) = OpenGL.preservingMatrix (do { OpenGL.rotate angle (OpenGL.Vector3 x y z) ; render child })
	
data Key = UpArrow
	| DownArrow
	| LeftArrow
	| RightArrow

data KeyTransition = Down
	| Up

data Message = Keystroke Key KeyTransition

data DrawFrameStimulus = DrawFrameStimulus

class ReactionGraph graph stimulus response where
	run :: graph -> stimulus -> response

data RotatedTriangle a = RotatedTriangle (Vector a) (Vector a) (Vector a) a a

instance Num t => ReactionGraph (RotatedTriangle t) Message (RotatedTriangle t) where
	run (RotatedTriangle a b c pitch yaw) message = RotatedTriangle a b c newpitch newyaw where
		newpitch = case message of
			(Keystroke UpArrow Down) -> pitch + 10
			(Keystroke DownArrow Down) -> pitch - 10
			_ -> pitch
		newyaw = case message of
			(Keystroke LeftArrow Down) -> yaw + 10
			(Keystroke RightArrow Down) -> yaw - 10
			_ -> yaw
	
instance Num t => ReactionGraph (RotatedTriangle t) DrawFrameStimulus (Scene t) where
	run (RotatedTriangle a b c pitch yaw) _ = Rotated pitch (Vector3 1 0 0) $ Rotated yaw (Vector3 0 1 0) $ Triangle a b c

main :: IO ()
main = do
	(progName, _) <- GLUT.getArgsAndInitialize
	GLUT.initialDisplayMode GLUT.$= [GLUT.RGBAMode, GLUT.DoubleBuffered, GLUT.WithDepthBuffer, GLUT.WithAlphaComponent]
	GLUT.createWindow progName
	rgRef <- newIORef $ RotatedTriangle (Vector3 (-0.5) 0 0) (Vector3 0.5 0 0) (Vector3 0 1 0) 0 0
	GLUT.displayCallback GLUT.$= doDisplay rgRef
	GLUT.idleCallback GLUT.$= Just (doDisplay rgRef)
	GLUT.keyboardMouseCallback GLUT.$= Just (onKey rgRef)
	GLUT.clearColor GLUT.$= (GLUT.Color4 0 0 0 0)
	GLUT.matrixMode GLUT.$= GLUT.Projection
	OpenGL.depthFunc OpenGL.$= Just OpenGL.Less
	OpenGL.blendFunc OpenGL.$= (OpenGL.SrcAlpha, OpenGL.OneMinusSrcAlpha)
	OpenGL.blend OpenGL.$= OpenGL.Enabled
	GLUT.mainLoop

doDisplay :: (ReactionGraph a DrawFrameStimulus b, OpenGLScene b) => IORef a -> GLUT.DisplayCallback
doDisplay rgRef = do
--	(TOD seconds picoseconds) <- getClockTime
	OpenGL.loadIdentity
	OpenGL.frustum (-1) 1 (-1) 1 1 3
	OpenGL.translate (OpenGL.Vector3 0 0 (-2 :: Double))
	GLUT.clear [GLUT.ColorBuffer, GLUT.DepthBuffer]
	OpenGL.currentColor OpenGL.$= (OpenGL.Color4 1 1 1 1)
	rg <- readIORef rgRef
	render $ run rg DrawFrameStimulus
	OpenGL.currentColor OpenGL.$= (OpenGL.Color4 0 0.5 0 0.5)
	OpenGL.renderPrimitive OpenGL.TriangleStrip $ do
		OpenGL.vertex $ OpenGL.Vertex3 (-1) (-1) (0 :: Double)
		OpenGL.vertex $ OpenGL.Vertex3 1 (-1) (0 :: Double)
		OpenGL.vertex $ OpenGL.Vertex3 (-1) 1 (0 :: Double)
		OpenGL.vertex $ OpenGL.Vertex3 1 1 (0 :: Double)
	GLUT.swapBuffers

onKey :: (ReactionGraph a Message a) => IORef a -> GLUT.KeyboardMouseCallback
onKey _ (GLUT.Char '\27') _ (GLUT.Modifiers {GLUT.shift = GLUT.Up, GLUT.ctrl = GLUT.Up, GLUT.alt = GLUT.Up}) _ = exitWith ExitSuccess
onKey rgRef (GLUT.Char x) state _ _ = do
	rg <- readIORef rgRef
	maybe (return ()) (\k -> writeIORef rgRef $ run rg $ Keystroke k s) key where 
	key = case x of
		'w' -> Just UpArrow
		's' -> Just DownArrow
		'a' -> Just LeftArrow
		'd' -> Just RightArrow
		_ -> Nothing
	s = case state of
		GLUT.Up -> Up
		GLUT.Down -> Down
onKey _ _ _ _ _ = return ()

title: blaa
contents:
Bei WG311(T) gibt es verschiedene Treiber-Versionen zum Thema "Super-G"-Modus. Die "ohne T" geht max. mit 54 MBit/s, die "mit T" sehe ich mit 108. - Rat-1: Den letzten + richtigen Treiber verwenden. Dies nur deshalb, weil mir etwas mit einem "Idle-Timeout" untergekommen ist.


Mein Favorit: Beim Stöbern gab es stets Probleme mit dem Super-G-Modus. Ansatz: Das Rating _manuell_ von 108 MBit/s niedriger einstellen, zumindest versuchsweise, zB. auf 11 MBit/s.

Daher noch ne ganz dumme Frage meinerseits: Die Karte befolgt den 802.11g-Standard, der Router den b-Standard. Wäre da nicht DG-834-GT passender? Oder anderherum: Eine fixe 11 MBit/s nicht sinnvoll?

Ich tippe mal darauf, dass sich die Karte beim DownRaten von 108 auf 11 "verschluckt". Dies würde auch den Dauertraffic erklären.

-Ace-
_____________

http://www.netgear.de/download/katalog/05/wireless05.pdf p.54
http://www.netgear.de/download/katalog/05/netzwerkadapter05.pdf
http://www.netgear.de/download/katalog/05/router05.pdf

title: a poor ripoff of perl's Text::Template
contents:
#|
Here Is The Documentation:

Suppose a file test-template with the following contents:

  here is some text
  #<(side-effect) (* 2 3)>#
  and some more text #<t># here

we do

  TEXT-TEMPLATE> (with-open-file (i "/home/dan/test-template") (make-instance 'text-template :stream i))
  #<TEXT-TEMPLATE {9A54AA1}>
  TEXT-TEMPLATE> (fill-in * *standard-output*)
  here is some text
  6
  and some more text T here
  NIL

Non-default delimiters can be specified as initargs.  Delimiters don't
nest (despite any appearance to the contrary that may have been given
by my choice of a matched pair as default) so choose some that won't
occur in the code

Each expression within a set of delimiters is evaluated for
side-effect and the primary return value of the last such expression
is printed to the stream as if by PRINC.  FILL-IN also takes a &rest
arg, the contents of which are available to the delimited expressions
in the special variable *ARGS*.  See also *TEMPLATE* and *STREAM*

|#

title: LET-KEYS
contents:
(define-syntax let-keys
  (syntax-rules ()
    ((let-keys ?alist (?bindings ...)
       ?body ...)
     (let ((alist ?alist))
       (%let-keys alist (?bindings ...)
         ?body ...)))))

(define-syntax %let-keys
  (syntax-rules ()
    ((let-keys ?alist ()
       ?body ...)
     (begin ?body ...))

    ((let-keys ?alist ((?name ?default)
                       ?rest ...)
       ?body ...)
     (let ((?name (let ((val (assq '?name ?alist)))
                    (if val
                        (cadr val)
                        ?default))))
       (let-keys ?alist (?rest ...)
         ?body ...)))

    ((let-keys ?alist (?name
                       ?rest ...)
       ?body ...)
     (let ((?name (cadr (or (assq '?name ?alist)
                            (error "Required keyword argument not specified"
                                   '?name)))))
       (let-keys ?alist (?rest ...)
         ?body ...)))))

(defun slime-init-command (port-filename coding-system)
  "Return a string to initialize Lisp."
  (let ((loader (if (file-name-absolute-p slime-backend)
                    slime-backend
                  (concat slime-path slime-backend)))
        (encoding (slime-coding-system-cl-name coding-system)))
    (format "%S\n%S\n%S\n\n"
            `(trace file-write-date probe-file)
            `(load ,loader :verbose t)
            `(swank:start-server ,port-filename :external-format ,encoding))))

title: tree depth
contents:
hey all

i am trying to compute the sum of the depths of all nodes in a tree

this is my code:
i am missing sometng out

the depth of a root is 1

(define (tree-depth-sum t)
  (tree-depth-sum-iter t 0))

(define (tree-depth-sum-iter t sum)
  (cond ((empty-tree? t) sum)
        ((and (not(null? (tree->left t))) (not(null? (tree->right t)))
      (+ 1( + 1 (tree-depth-sum-iter (tree->right t) (+ sum 1)))  (+ 1(tree-depth-sum-iter (tree->left t) (+ sum 1))))))
           ((and (null? (tree->left t)) (not(null? (tree->right t)))
       (+ 1(+ 1(tree-depth-sum-iter (tree->right t) (+ sum 1))))))
              ((and (not(null? (tree->left t))) (null? (tree->right t))
       (+ 1(+ 1(tree-depth-sum-iter (tree->left t) (+ sum 1))))))
                     ((and (null? (tree->left t)) (null? (tree->right t))
        (+ 1 sum) ))))

title: delete-region-and-yank
contents:
(defun delete-region-and-yank (&optional arg)
  "Deletes region if mark is active and yanks the last kill.
Always replaces the region with the yank, whether the region was
selected via keyboard or mouse.  Also works for normal
yank even with ARGS (thus it can be mapped to \C-y)"
  (interactive "p")
  (if mark-active
      (let ((str (buffer-substring (point) (mark))))
        (delete-region (point) (mark))
        (if (STRING= str (current-kill 0 1))
            (let ((str2 (current-kill 1 1)))
              (kill-new str2 t)))))
  (if arg
      (yank arg)
      (yank)))

title: get-host-entry-in-thread
contents:
(defun get-host-entry-in-thread (name)
  (let ((mutex (sb-thread:make-mutex))
        (queue (sb-thread:make-waitqueue))
        result error)
    (sb-thread:make-thread
     (lambda ()
       (block nil
         (sb-thread:with-mutex (mutex)
           (handler-case
               (multiple-value-setq (result error)
                 (ignore-errors (sb-bsd-sockets:get-host-by-name name)))
             (sb-bsd-sockets:host-not-found-error (e)
               (setf error e)
               (return)))))
       (sb-thread:condition-notify queue)))
    (sb-thread:with-mutex (mutex)
      (loop
       (when (or result error)
         (return))
       (sb-thread:condition-wait queue mutex)))
    (if error
        (error error)
        result)))

(define (gnomon a b)
  (let ((l (sort-list (append a b) <)))
    (reverse (fold (lambda (item lis)
                     (if (= item (car lis))
                         lis
                         (cons item lis)))
                   (list (car l))
                   (cdr l)))))

;;; I'd usually indent it like this:

(define (gnomon a b)
  (let ((l (sort-list (append a b)
                      <)))
    (reverse
     (fold (lambda (item lis)
             (if (= item (car lis))
                 lis
                 (cons item lis)))
           (list (car l))
           (cdr l)))))
